title: Made the Harbor
label: Bella Union
description: Vermont trio builds on its blog buzz with an album of old-timey music highlighted by the group's lovely bell-toned voices.

title: Infra
description: The latest from the electro-acoustic composer with a flair for slow, aching beauty was originally commissioned for a multimedia performance piece.

title: Lazers Never Die EP
label: Mad Decent
description: Diplo and Switch supplement their 2009 dancehall record with this EP, a summertime's worth of originals and reinterpretations. Thom Yorke and M.I.A. appear.

title: Flaws
label: Island
description: The UK band goes from teenage post-punk acolytes to Nick Drake- and John Martyn-loving folkies in one move.

title: Serotonin
label: Rough Trade
description: On their third LP, and first for Rough Trade, the UK former prog-pop band now essentially fully strips the "prog" from its music.

title: Libraries
label: Merge
description: After a lo-fi triumph, Stuart McLamb records his second LP in a proper studio, supplementing his melodic gifts with reverb and colorful arrangements.

title: Kicking at the Perfumed Air
label: self-released
description: The late ex-Wilco man has his mostly completed record of stalwart, sad, often quite affecting pop-rock songs posthumously released.

title: The Way Out
label: Temporary Residence
description: The Books' fourth album and first full-length in five years finds their knack for finding strange and wondrous samples intact.

title: Apparitions
label: Carpark
description: Chicago indie rock band serves up big choruses and post-Arcade Fire grandeur on its first LP.

title: Man Forever
label: St. Ives
description: Oneida drummer Kid Millions enlists members of Yeah Yeah Yeahs and Sightings for his first solo record.

title: Of Seismic Consequence
label: Profound Lore
description: Chicago metal band reaches for, and often locates, something mysterious and elemental on virtually every track of its new LP.

title: Learning
label: Matador
description: A strikingly intimate and affecting debut full-length from Seattle singer-songwriter Mike Hadreas.

title: Piratas de Sudamérica, Vol. 1
label: Young Turks
description: Following his successful LP Alegranza!, the Spanish producer returns with an EP containing re-workings of pre-rock songs from Latin America.

title: Unheard Ofs & Forgotten Abouts
label: Tompkins Square
description: This evangelical for old-timey music crafts a mixtape of global folk songs-- Scotland to Nairobi; China to Appalachia-- from his record collection.

title: Fabulous Diamonds II
label: Siltbreeze
description: The Aussie duo stretches their murky and zonked-out stoner vibes even further on their latest album, which drafts elements of dub, repetition, and minimalism.

title: LA Vampires Meets Zola Jesus EP
label: Not Not Fun
description: This collaboration between Zola Jesus leader Nika Rosa Danilova and Pocahaunted member Amanda Brown is the polar opposite of polished.

title: Night Light
label: Moshi Moshi
description: Delicate synth-pop act gets remixed by Neon Indian, Jens Lekman, and the Dirty Projectors' Angel Deradoorian.

title: Move of Ten
label: Warp
description: Their second LP in a matter of months, Move of Ten is a beat-driven complement to Oversteps' dubstep-nodding ambiance.

title: Wildwood
label: Yep Roc
description: North Carolina Americana band continues to impress, colliding their bluegrass more than ever with other strains of country music.

title: Scared
label: White Denim
description: The overcast moods and broken tempos of this dance vet are informed by Villalobos and Pantha, but also come off like kin to the xx and witch house.

title: They'll Only Miss You When You Leave: Songs 1996 - 2003
label: Hardly Art
description: Former beloved local Seattle band-- a stepping stone for virtually every early Band of Horses member-- has its best moments collected and released.

title: Disconnect From Desire
label: Vagrant
description: This collaboration between Secret Machines and On! Air! Library! members returns, again with shoegaze motifs married to assertive pop melodies.

title: Fables of the Reconstruction [Deluxe Edition]
label: Capitol
description: R.E.M.'s overlooked and transitional third album from 1985, produced by Joe Boyd, receives the deluxe reissue treatment.

title: Fuck Winter / Regolith Vol. 1 / Patient Sounds Sampler V. 1
label: Scotch Tapes
description: Three comps from under-the-radar labels issuing cassettes and vinyl in limited quanities highlight a range of strange sounds from all over.

title: New Sounds
label: Discourage Records
description: In 1974, Bob Desper released his only album-- limited to a 500-copy pressing on a local Christian imprint. Discourage reissues it now.

title: Part II: The New December
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: Liars cohorts and tourmates locate that band's sense of rhythmically obtuse and dense appeal yet often make almost whimsical pop out of it.

title: Admiral Fell Promises
label: Caldo Verde
description: Working alone with just a nylon-string guitar, Mark Kozelek takes a new tack under his Sun Kil Moon alias.

title: Love King
label: Def Jam
description: On his third album, the influential R&B singer/songwriter comes into his own as an album artist, getting over on his impeccable sense of craft.

title: No Great Lost: Songs, 1979-1985
label: Casa Nueva
description: Following recent reissues of Pylon and Method Actors, another great lost Southern new wave artist has his work unearthed.

title: I Mean to Live Here Still
label: Fat Cat
description: Pairing with the Virgina jazz ensemble Fight the Big Bull, the singer-songwriter has found an intriguing new setting for his somber tales.

title: Mystery Tape EP
label: Lefse
description: Denver-based instrumental psych band has a real feel for dark mood and atmosphere on their latest.

title: Can't See My Own Face - The Eternal Love 2
label: self-released
description: Promising newcomer Tom Krell marries the intimacy of cheaply recorded bedroom pop with lush melodicism and a tinge of R&B.

title: / \ / \ / \ Y / \
label: Interscope
description: After two game-changing LPs and the surprise 2008 success of "Paper Planes", M.I.A. returns with an album heavy on noise and light on memorable songs.

title: Palenque Palenque: Champeta Criolla & Afro Roots in Colombia 1975-91
label: Soundway
description: This engaging comp from Britain's Soundway documents the evolution of a unique scene that grew from a mix of Colombian and West African pop.

title: En Fin Tid
label: Smalltown Supersound
description: The Norwegian producer with an ear for bubbly summer dance music builds on that sound and experiments with some new moods.

title: Spirituals
label: Waaga
description: Mixing recordings of free jazz ensembles with electronics, Portland's Tyler Tadlock mines the tension between efficient technology and messy humanity.

title: The Story of an Artist
label: Munster
description: This 6xCD box collects Johnston's earliest releases, including Songs of Pain and two volumes of The Lost Recordings*.*

title: Cerulean
label: Anticon
description: L.A. producer Will Wiesenfeld incorporates the woozy pitch-shifted samples of local beatmaking peers into surprisingly affecting songs.

title: Privilege
label: c.sides
description: The Cologne-based producer crafts a minimal techno world so repetitive and stark it begins to feel like ambient.

title: Ragged and Right
label: Thrill Jockey
description: This EP finds the late guitarist working with No-Neck Blues Band's Dave Shuford on a set of loose, energetic covers of tunes by Link Wray and Merle Haggard.

title: Treasure State
label: Cantaloupe
description: The New York-based new music ensemble teams with the sample maestros on a highly tactile album that draws inspiration from the American landscape.

title: Funstyle
label: self-released
description: The veteran singer-songwriter surprise releases a new album, and it's a baffling mix of wacky beat-driven tunes and more conventional songs.

title: Flesh Tone
label: Interscope
description: Focusing more than ever on dance music with an album the flows like a DJ set, the left-field R&B diva has made her most consistent record in years.

title: Taste the Sin
label: Relapse
description: Savannah's Black Tusk mix metal and hardcore in a way sometimes reminiscent of Weedeater or Baroness but with an approach all their own.

title: Bonjour
label: Knitting Factory
description: The Algerian-born bandleader with a knack for mixing rock, reggae, techno, raï, and Arab pop tries a new producer and a dialed-down sound.

title: Chapter Ahead Being Fake EP
label: Hydra Head
description: This split 10" shines due to Boris' contribution, which finds them mixing black metal and shoegaze into a sound that resists categorization.

title: Touched EP
label: Merok
description: On their debut EP, this promising Brooklyn duo offers up a homemade take on Lindstrøm-style space-disco.

title: Mount Wittenberg Orca
label: self-released
description: Dirty Projectors and Björk self-release a folksy, dressed-down, and appealing song cycle for charity that was written and assembled quickly.

title: Roachy Balboa
label: Thizz City
description: The young Bay Area rapper returns with his second album that nicely balances acrobatic rap style, storytelling, and humor.

title: Fantision
label: Schematic
description: Prolific producer who has released almost 50 albums in the last 10 years doesn't rush his electro-acoustic soundscapes here.

title: Reservoir Songs II EP
label: Foreign Leisure
description: Eric Bachmann releases his second covers EP, here tackling the Kinks, Merle Haggard, Waylon Jennings, Glen Campbell, and Thin Lizzy.

title: Immer 3
label: Kompakt
description: The Kompakt proprietor releases the third volume in his flagship mix series, featuring tracks by Cortney Tidwell, Massive Attack, and more.

title: Sir Lucious Left Foot: The Son of Chico Dusty
label: Def Jam
description: After years of label drama and leaked tracks that hinted at something great, the OutKast MC exceeds high expectations on his proper solo debut.

title: Lustre
label: Nice
description: Following his 2007 best-of, the British singer-songwriter returns with an album that finds him trying his hand at some new styles.

title: O.M.G.!
label: Mad Decent
description: Dubstep producer does crossover on his debut album for Mad Decent, including collaborations with Amber Coffman and Gucci Mane.

title: Shut Up, Dude
label: Greedhead
description: Following on the success of the novelty song "Combination Pizza Hut and Taco Bell", Das Racist return with a smart, funny, and engaging mixtape.

title: Mr. Zone 6
label: self-released
description: After another stint in prison, the rapper is back on the mixtape circuit and he hasn't lost a step.

title: Fabric 52
label: Fabric
description: The Scottish duo's club night of the same name is no more, but their partnership continues with this mix, among the most techno-heavy of their career.

title: Listen for the Clues
label: self-released
description: Drew Patrizi of What Made Milwaukee Famous returns with a new band with some seriously maximalist orchestral pop tendencies.

title: Addicts: Black Meddle, Part II
label: Century Media
description: Extending beyond black metal to incorporate more synths and studio polish, Nachtmystium hold on to their crushing heaviness.

title: Base World, Pt. 1
label: self-released
description: This recent mixtape from the madly prolific YouTube rapper and member of the Bay Area crew the Pack gives a good overview of his off-the-dome style.

title: Night Work
label: Polydor
description: Latest from the NYC band beloved across the pond shifts thematic focus from camp to overt sexuality and has a darker, more 1980s-informed sound.

title: King of the Beach
label: Fat Possum
description: On this strong return after a tough year, Nathan Williams enlists Jay Reatard's backing band, polishes his sound, and embraces pop-punk clarity.

title: Fever
label: ATP
description: California band with a classic rock lean mixes British folk, stoner metal, and more into a swirling psych stew.

title: Swung From the Branches
label: Moodgadget
description: This promising project from Toronto is indebted to the atmospheric dream pop of Atlas Sound but manages to carve out its own identity.

title: Earth vs. the Pipettes
label: Fortuna Pop!
description: Initially dreamed up as a modern girl group, the Pipettes took the exercise one step too far with a revolving-door membership and and an emphasis on conceit.

title: Square Shells EP
label: Matador
description: A between-albums EP from the psych-folk singer-songwriter continues his winning streak.

title: White Magic
label: Modular
description: Eric Berglund of the Tough Alliance steps out with a solo project that combines effortless electro-pop with lush orchestral pieces to dazzling effect.

title: We Are All One, in the Sun: A Tribute to Robbie Basho
label: Important
description: American primitivist Robbie Basho is honored on this comp, with contributions from Espers' Meg Baird, Helena Espvall, and more.

title: Catoptric
label: Social Registry
description: After the disappointing Mirror Eye, the psych-droners return with a more expansive and engaging record cut around the same time.

title: Cosmology
label: Hassle
description: British hardcore band enlists Diplo to craft their latest record of frenzy and fractal math rock.

title: Outlaster
label: Fat Cat
description: The singer-songwriter embellishes her sparse, haunted folk sound with strings and woodwinds to superb effect.

title: Expo 86
label: Sub Pop
description: On their third full-length, the indie supergroup led by Dan Boeckner and Spencer Krug sounds more unified as their songwriting voices bleed together.

title: Ramadanman EP
label: Hessle
description: Breaking post-dubstep into detours such as glitchy, out-of-step rhythms and breakbeat hardcore creates an inviting record.

title: Perch Patchwork
label: Barsuk
description: Chicago band leaves the math-rock musicianship of previous releases behind, turning their quirks into something diverse and accessible.

title: Dansette Dansette
label: Slumberland
description: Indie pop vets whose work dates back to late-1980s twee-punk band Talulah Gosh return to find a revival of what they've been doing all along.

title: Peoples Potential Family Album
label: Peoples Potential Unlimited
description: The Peoples Potential Unlimited imprint assembled this impressive collection of ultra-obscure early-1980s disco and funk.

title: Mare
label: Olde English Spelling Bee
description: Former Ridgewood, NJ-based singer/songwriter takes a major creative leap, refining his eclectic collage-pop aesthetic while retaining its emotional tug.

title: Chicago
label: Dial
description: The Berlin techno producer crafts a lengthy and austere album filled with psychedelic touches and odd bits of humor.

title: Jazeera Nights: Folk and Pop Sounds of Syria
label: Sublime Frequencies
description: Another excellent Sublime Frequencies collection of Omar Souleyman's work, these very modern electronic Arabic folk songs were recorded live.

title: Get Him to the Greek OST
label: Universal Republic
description: Russell Brand's fictional band from the film sends up British rock, with songwriting help from Jarvis Cocker and the Libertines' Carl Barât.

title: Magic Bullets
label: Mon Amie
description: San Francisco band draws from some obvious indie pop touchstones and manages a solid batch of convincing and affecting songs.

title: How I Got Over
label: Def Jam
description: The Roots' latest is also their leanest and most stylistically cohesive LP to date. Guests include Joanna Newsom, Dirty Projectors, Phonte, Blu, and Jim James.

title: All Creatures Will Make Merry
label: Song, by Toad
description: Edinburgh band combines tricky drumming, string swells, banjo solos, and rousing refrains on a compelling record with serious emotional pull.

title: Dagger Paths
label: Olde English Spelling Bee
description: On this impressive record, the UK producer's haunted sound evokes faded memories, ghostly auras, and dream states but also remains grounded and forceful.

title: DJ-Kicks
label: !K7
description: Hyperdub boss and dubstep star crafts a mix that includes usual suspects like Zomby and Ikonika, plus excursions into R&B and South African house.

title: Life Magazine Remixes EP
label: Matador
description: Not simply a quickie remix collection, Cold Cave get heavyweights Optimo, Arthur Baker, Pantha Du Prince, and Delorean to re-imagine their recent single.

title: The Boxer
label: Polydor
description: Like the Strokes' Julian Casablancas before him, the Bloc Party singer explores electronic textures on his solo debut.

title: Against Love
label: Secretly Canadian
description: In the midst of a 90s revival, this actual 90s band looks back and re-traces some of its earliest ambient-pop steps as a group.

title: Star Tiger Star Ariel
label: Lookout Mountain
description: Undersung UK guitar pop act puts its head down and rocks out for the first time in its career.

title: Allo Darlin'
label: Fortuna Pop!
description: London-based foursome-- with ties to Hefner and Amelia Flecther-- issue the first excellent no-frills twee-pop record in a few years.

title: Time Flies
label: Big Brother
description: The absolutely enormous rock band reminds us that they got that way by simply communicating basic truths and basic melodies. Over and over and over again.

title: Disco2
label: Lovepump United
description: The second album-length remix collection from HEALTH finds artists like Pictureplane, Crystal Castles, and CFCF re-working songs from Get Color.

title: Martian's Bloom
label: American Myth
description: Ambitious indie rock band works in the same vein as the Bad Seeds, Tindersticks, or the Dirty Three.

title: Southern Gothic
label: Virgin
description: Trying to be for Atlanta what Lou Reed or Brian Wilson are for NYC or California, this gothic rock band enlists Cee-Lo and Asher Roth on their debut LP.

title: The Threshingfloor
label: Sounds Familyre
description: On their latest, Wovenhand mix traces of Indian, Celtic, and Middle Eastern folk into songs delivered with a preacher's fervor.

title: Splazsh
label: Honest Jon's
description: Nominally working under the umbrella of dubstep, this London producer has called his music "R&B concrète"-- a celebration of the abstract and the pop.

title: Cocainism, Vol. 2
label: Ice H2O
description: More upbeat and loose than Cuban Linx II, this mixtape is simply a display of Raekwon's oft-overlooked, masterful technique.

title: The Offending Party
label: Max
description: Former Grifters members recall that band's soulful lo-fi cacophony with a record that nicely dovetails with today's penchant for slop and chaos.

title: Sinister Devices
label: Kanine
description: Promising Florida dream-pop outfit debuts with an album that finds the right balance between gossamer and grit.

title: About to Choke [Reissue]
label: Capitol
description: The late singer-songwriter has his dark, death-obsessed major-label debut reissued.

title: Homeland
label: Nonesuch
description: The Downtown NYC fixture's first album in a decade is an exquisite state-of-the-union dispatch from a darkly comic conscience.

title: The Five Ghosts
label: Vagrant
description: The Toronto indie pop veterans follow their theatrical, big-room work with a more muted, grayer record.

title: We Are Born
label: Jive
description: Sia migrates from understated R&B to energetic pop with a few refreshing results.

title: Oh EP
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Marking his return as Oval after a 10-year absence, glitch pioneer Markus Popp issues a sharp, prickly, and finely detailed EP.

title: Bang Goes the Knighthood
label: Divine Comedy
description: Neil Hannon continues to quietly and effectively operate his own one-man niche, thanks to impeccable arrangements and tightrope-walking songwriting.

title: Go! Common Classics
label: Geffen
description: Common already readies his second best-of record-- and unfortunately this one focuses on the nadir of his fruitful career.

title: Recovery
label: Interscope
description: The rapper's next comeback LP, this is meant to trace Em's journey out of depression and drug addiction and back into the peak of his powers.

title: Two Agents
label: Audraglint
description: Now a duo, Signaldrift continue to meld IDM, krautrock, and post-rock with often schizophrenic results.

title: El Che
label: Allido
description: On the endlessly delayed follow-up to the overlooked Blue Collar, the Chicago hip-hop vet aims to put his career back on track.

title: Something For Everybody
label: Warner Bros.
description: Despite a shaky start, Devo's first LP in 20 years turns out to be more than a marketing and conceptual gesture.

title: Freiland Klaviermusik
label: Profan
description: The Kompakt mainstay-- who has recorded as Gas and Studio 1, and as part of Burger/Ink-- creates a strange, drum-less, almost monastic take on techno.

title: Further
label: Virgin
description: Scrapping big-name guests and harnessing the live fury they've shown in recent years, the Chems make their best LP in more than a decade.

title: Homemade Extacy
label: Waaga
description: This duo from Denton, Texas, make electro-infused noise that sometimes recalls HEALTH and Fuck Buttons.

title: Baby Style EP
label: Lefse
description: Lefse band in debt to Panda Bear follows its excellent "Yellow Wings" single with this EP.

title: Chasing After Shadows... Living With the Ghosts
label: Hammock
description: Hammock have a unique sound that lies between the deep ambient of Stars of the Lid and the anthemic rock of the Church.

title: American Slang
label: SideOneDummy
description: Rockers in the mold of Springsteen and Strummer are not just a band simply awash in nostalgia; their songs are about the very concept of nostalgia.

title: Lazerproof
label: Mad Decent
description: Diplo and Switch take a risk, building a mixtape of modern rap, R&B, dancehall, and dubstep rhythms around the icy synth-pop of La Roux.

title: Melted
label: Goner
description: In the wake of Jay Reatard's passing, this San Fran garage-punker is one of rock's better razor-sharp throwback tunesmiths.

title: False Lights From the Land EP
label: Mute
description: The modern-day crooner highlights Truelove's Gutter epic "Remorse Code" on an EP that also features a pair of covers and a new song.

title: Tacklebox
label: Cake
description: For the third year in a row, the Chicago hip-hop duo celebrated Memorial Day by issuing a mixtape of retro-minded boom-bap.

title: Future Breeds
label: Dangerbird
description: Hot Hot Heat return to an indie (Dangerbird) and make their best album since 2002's Make Up the Breakdown.

title: Thank Me Later
label: Young Money Entertainment
description: Inspired by rap and R&B in equal measure, Drake becomes the first of the post-Kanye, emo-y rappers to fully deliver on his debut LP.

label: Sublime Frequencies
description: Despite attempts to outlaw rock, Indonesia became a hotbed of pop and R&B as two new compilations from Sublime Frequencies prove.

title: Goodbye, Killer
label: Ashmont
description: After a four-year break, Joe Pernice's band returns, a little stripped down but still crafting pop nuggets in hock to the pop nuggets of the past.

title: Wild Smile
label: Frenchkiss
description: Brooklyn art-rockers build on the promise of their 2009 EP with a record of wheelhouse emotionally nourishing indie rock.

title: Fuck a Mixtape
label: Unknown
description: On his latest mixtape, T.I. again proves how good a rapper he is-- perfectly in control of voice and flow and meter and cadence.

title: How to Destroy Angels
label: The Null Corporation
description: Trent Reznor returns, emphasizing plaintive downtempo ballads and ceding vocal duties to ex-West Indian Girl singer Mariqueen Maandig.

title: My Neighbor/My Creator
label: Merge
description: Bold new EP from the dream-folk band embraces negative space, hip-hop, and fingerpicking and somehow make them all work.

title: Walls
label: Kompakt
description: Banjo or Freakout's Alessio Natalizia and the guy behind the Allez-Allez podcast craft ambient-pop for Kompakt.

title: Becoming a Jackal
label: Domino
description: Irish folk-pop artist Conor O'Brien is getting a lot of NPR/mainstream attention for his emotionally nourishing music.

title: Champ
label: Mom & Pop
description: After their shaky 2008 full-length debut, Elephant Shell, Tokyo Police Club return with an album that recaptures some of their early promise.

title: Returnal
label: Editions Mego
description: After the sprawling Rifts, one of drone's top new artists returns with a more focused yet more complex album.

title: ...And They Have Escaped the Weight of Darkness
label: Erased Tapes
description: The young Icelandic composer who has toured with Sigur Rós continues to develop and refine his string-and-piano-heavy sound.

title: Broken Hearts & Dirty Windows: Songs of John Prine
label: Oh Boy
description: Chicago folk legend is honored by Conor Oberst, Bon Iver, Drive-By Truckers, Lambchop, and more.

title: Assume Crash Position
label: Crammed Discs
description: Five years since Congotronics introduced Konono to a broader international audience, the Congolese band releases its second studio album.

title: Rope and Summit EP
label: Mute
description: José González reforms his old band, nicely amplifying both his sound and the underlying rhythmic force in his solo material.

title: Disintegration [Deluxe Edition]
label: Rhino
description: The Cure's 1989 album, released during what was arguably the band's peak period, receives a lavish reissue with some terrific bonus material

title: Living
label: Thrill Jockey
description: The busy Virginia band return with another album of dense, rumbling blues-rock heavy on the instrumentals.

title: Topp Stemning På Lokal Bar
label: Polyvinyl
description: The fine debut from this Norwegian dance-pop band is a satisfying blend of the tropic and the cosmic.

title: Twistable, Turnable Man: A Musical Tribute to the Songs of Shel Silverstein
label: Sugar Hill
description: The famed children's author and songwriter is honored by My Morning Jacket, Andrew Bird, Frank Black, Kris Kristofferson, and more.

title: The Shape of Punk to Come: A Chimerical Bombination in 12 Bursts [Deluxe Edition]
label: Epitaph
description: The legendary LP from the Swedish hardcore band is given a deluxe reissue with a live album, video, and a documentary.

title: Does It Look Like I'm Here?
label: Editions Mego
description: Prolific drone act follows last year's What Happened with a zoned-out epic in the vein of 70s space-rock giants Tangerine Dream and Ash Ra Tempel.

title: A Memory Is Better Than Nothing
label: Rocket Girl
description: The legendary Dan Treacy reconvenes his band for an album about hurting so badly that it's no longer possible to express the pain clearly.

title: The Jayhawks
label: Lost Highway
description: The alt-country forebears finally have their almost mythical debut LP, nicknamed The Bunkhouse Album, released.

title: Into the Great Wide Yonder
label: In My Room
description: Creator of a string of excellent singles, and remixes for the Knife and Röyksopp, the versatile techno producer unveils his latest LP.

title: The Drums
label: Island
description: One of indie pop's most promising bands navigates the tension between its populist and insular tendencies on its sure-to-break-out LP.

title: LP4
label: XL
description: Crafted from leftovers from the LP3 sessions, Ratatat's latest is another take on their signature sound-- slick electro-pop heavily infused with hip-hop.

title: Heavy Ghost Appendices
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: Singer/songwriter collects covers, B-sides, remixes, do-overs, and other odds and ends from the past year. Bibio and Rafter are among the remixers.

title: Year of Panic
label: Captured Tracks
description: Brooklyn's Captured Tracks unveils an excellent record from a one-man German band in the spirit of Vivian Girls and caUSE co-MOTION!

title: Eccentric Breaks and Beats
label: Numero Group
description: Reissue label supreme Numero Group loved this bootleg collection of their samples (created by Shoes) so much they released it officially.

title: Pigeons
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Luke Temple hires a band and, led by the outstanding "Collector" single, expands upon the promise of his debut as Here We Go Magic.

title: Before Today
label: 4AD
description: After a decade of home recorded releases on smaller labels, Ariel Pink jumps to 4AD and makes the best record of his career.

title: The Black Dirt Sessions
label: Partisan
description: Downcast roots rockers led by John McCauley return with album number three.

title: The Bride Screamed Murder
label: Ipecac
description: The grunge mainstays return with another record full of unexpected twists, turns, jokes, diversions, and ideas.

title: Dirty South Dance 2
label: self-released
description: The second volume of A-Trak's Southern hip-hop-meets European-electro-house mash-up series keeps the party going.

title: Tiger Bay / Finisterre
label: Heavenly
description: The latest deluxe reissues from St. Etienne come from a period when they hit on the right mix of pastoral folk and silvery electronics.

title: Destroyer of the Void
label: Sub Pop
description: Portland band continues to explore the rugged late-60s roots-rock of Bob Dylan and the Band while also spreading out and displaying their eclectic nature.

title: See You on the Moon
label: Fantasy
description: Alt-country songstress finally takes full advantage of her gift for intimate, fragile songwriting on her latest LP.

title: The Champ Is Here 3
label: self-released
description: After a few lame actual records, Jadakiss responds with a surprisingly taut and triumphant mixtape.

title: Callin' All
label: Interscope
description: The much-loved Liverpool band has its brief career stretched to four CDs by including singles, B-sides, demos, radio sessions, and live stuff.

title: Shadows
label: Merge
description: Veteran Scottish band shrug off their midlife crisis record, 2005's Man Made, returning to their classic Byrds-esque sound.

title: Gemini
label: Captured Tracks
description: Wild Nothing's achingly beautiful reflection of 80s dream-pop carves a tunnel from Ibiza's beaches to Manchester's rain-soaked fairgrounds.

title: Trash Kit
label: Upset the Rhythm
description: Introducing a UK female trio faithfiul to the small-scale, distortion-free punk of the Slits and the Raincoats.

title: Suite #420
label: Koch
description: Yup, that title is a weed reference, and rapper Devin the Dude is still the self-deprecating stoner everyman.

title: Be Yourself: A Tribute to Graham Nash's Songs for Beginners
label: Grassroots
description: Fleet Foxes' Robin Pecknold, Bonnie "Prince" Billy, Brendan Benson, and others pay tribute to Graham Nash's most personal solo album.

title: Long Distance
label: All City
description: Parisian producer rolls together current trends-- broken beats, woozy aural effects, vintage funk and R&B-- into another great post-Dilla record.

title: Anidea
label: Punch Drunk
description: A pianist trained in jazz and classical, this post-dubstep producer is both methodical and highly melodic on his often stunning debut LP.

title: Dominant Curve
label: In a Circle
description: On their latest album, the new music ensemble interprets Debussy, John Cage, and others in unusual and compelling ways.

title: Me Oh My
label: Control Group
description: First released on Gruff Rhys' label, the debut from this Cardiff singer/songwriter buries the pop hooks and lets her freak-folk flag fly.

title: Curtis Lane EP
label: Filter
description: Prodigious talent Pat Grossi displays an aptitude for the grandeur and grace of M83, OMD, and Animal Collective on this new EP.

title: Say It
label: Warp
description: After a promising debut, Warp's spazz-pop band sounds adrift and unmoored on their second LP.

title: Body Talk Pt. 1
label: Interscope
description: Five years after the original issue of Robyn, the Swedish singer still has a knack for memorable pop gems.

title: Vespers
label: Soft Landing
description: The debut LP by this instrumental post-rock outfit led by a former member of Antony and the Johnsons is an intriguing mix of drone and improv.

title: Heaps of Nothing
label: Siltbreeze
description: The Australian duo's latest makes a small move toward accessibility but they are as noisy and abrasive as ever.

title: Deathbed +4 EP
label: Matador
description: After a lengthy hibernation, Chicago's top garage-rock band returns with a five-song EP.

title: Trap or Die II
label: CTE
description: A-list rapper brings his bulldozing delivery and deft ear for huge, gothic tracks to his new mixtape.

title: Innerspeaker
label: Modular
description: These Australians have crafted an assured and accomplished album that integrates an array of psych rock references into a powerful whole.

title: Peter Wolf Crier
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Minnesota duo channels the front-porch spirit of M. Ward on this collection of understated, ragged songs.

title: Well Done Europe
label: Lo
description: UK band's manic, meta-pop approach-- think Ray Davies or Jarvis Cocker-- doesn't so much plant tongue in cheek as pierce it right through.

title: K.R.I.T. Wuz Here
label: self-released
description: After being largely unknown throughout most of 2009, this Southern rapper is suddenly the next big blog-rap hope.

title: The Ghost Who Walks
label: XL
description: Supermodel and wife of the White Stripes' Jack White aims to transcend those two facts on her debut LP of murder ballads and country-rock.

title: Bigger and Blackerer
label: Sub Pop
description: Indie comedy's biggest star issues his first Sub Pop CD in six years.

title: A Thousand Voices EP
label: self-released
description: Chicago duo strike a productive bargain between raw primordial stomp and self-aware homage to 1990s alt-rock.

title: Three Kings
label: Xemu
description: The psych-rockers' latest is a multimedia set including a feature-length film that cuts between performance footage and loopy dream sequences.

title: Saint Bartlett
label: Secretly Canadian
description: The consistent indie rock journeyman makes one of the best records of his career with production assistance from Richard Swift.

title: Love and Its Opposite
label: Merge
description: Everything But the Girl singer continues to play the matriarch of love-lorn electronic music on her latest solo album. Ewan Pearson again produces.

title: Of Light / Shabazz Palaces
label: Templar Label Group
description: Ishmael Butler of Digable Planets has a very promising new solo project and he's out of the gate with two fine EPs.

title: Burners
label: Important
description: Former drone band continues to explore song-oriented material-- here, krautrock, gothic sludge, and Stooges-like pysch-garage.

title: Holy Ground: NYC Live with the Wordless Music Orchestra
label: Temporary Residence
description: Ambitious post-rock band further embraces strings by teaming with Wordless Music Orchestra on this live album.

title: The Samps EP
label: Mexican Summer
description: Band that includes a sometime member of Ariel Pink's Haunted Graffiti crafts a short, sharp, and satisfying EP of bent pop.

title: Maniac Meat
label: Anticon
description: The Black Moth Super Rainbow frontman returns with a more rough-edged and driving record that features two guest-spots from Beck.

title: Revolutions Per Minute
label: Blacksmith
description: Talib Kweli and Hi-Tek reunite under their Reflection Eternal name and continue the good work they've displayed for more than a decade.

title: Spirit Youth
label: Kanine
description: Wonderfully produced, this is the latest record from an indie pop band that shares members with Pains of Being Pure at Heart.

title: Splash
label: K
description: Jay moves from cinematic cityscapes and brittle indie toward the sloppy guitars and meaty chord progressions from MTV's "120 Minutes" heyday.

title: DJ-Kicks
label: !K7
description: Border Community head provides an alternative look at dance music, mostly avoiding the expected techno for a rich blend of current sounds.

title: Beach Fossils
label: Captured Tracks
description: Adopting the atmospherics of the Clientele and Real Esate, this Captured Tracks band manages to be both evocative and technically proficient.

title: CMYK EP
label: R&S
description: The prodigious London electronic producer, still only 21, crafts intricate music that's both deeply retro and futuristic.

title: Subject to Shift
label: Ghostly
description: Jason Amm visits darker and more beat-driven territory on his fifth album, but brings elements of his upbeat analog synth sound with him.

title: Dust
label: Bpitch Control
description: Bpitch label head and scene linchpin redefines herself as a melancholy techno-pop songwriter with interests well outside her Berlin dance sphere.

title: Now I Got Worry / Controversial Negro
label: Majordomo
description: The beat-infused mutant blues of Now I Got Worry and the incendiary live document Controversial Negro are reissued with bonus tracks.

title: Distant Relatives
label: Def Jam
description: Hip-hop and reggae stars follow their excellent "As We Enter" single with a full LP. This summer's jam-band festgoers are going to love it.

title: Compass
label: Warp
description: Stylistically diverse though still identifiably his work, the new record from Jamie Lidell enlists a huge cast-- including Beck, Feist, and Grizzly Bear.

title: Kitsuné Maison 9
label: Kitsuné
description: The latest comp from the French label includes contributions from Washed Out, Holy Ghost!, and Crookers.

title: Eyes & Nines
label: Trash Talk Collective
description: The Sacramento hardcore band captures the fury of their live show in a concise 18-minute blast of an album.

title: Dopeman Music
label: Facemob
description: After a pair of bleak so-called retirement records, the Houston rap vet returns limber and energized on his new mixtape.

title: Total Life Forever
label: Sub Pop
description: Eclectic UK band locates an emotional center amidst their mathematically arranged dance punk elements.

title: The ArchAndroid
label: Bad Boy
description: The singer/songwriter's new album is stunningly ambitious, veering from R&B to rap, pastoral British folk, psych rock, disco, and more.

title: Pure Moods EP
label: Drag City
description: Chicago band slows their kraut/noise blend down, sounding increasingly more like another set of Can lovers-- Stereolab.

title: Say God
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Though ostensibly about Christianity, this 2xCD record from the former Lungfish leader is actually more about mind and spirit than scripture.

title: OJ Simpson
label: Stones Throw
description: Cohesive, focused, and flat-out fun, Guilty Simpson and Madlib have crafted one of the best hip-hop records of the year.

title: Brothers
label: Nonesuch
description: After working with Danger Mouse on their last full-length, Black Keys sound re-energized and playful on their loosest record in years.

title: Exile on Main St. [Deluxe Edition]
label: Interscope
description: The 1972 classic is given a remaster and a deluxe reissue.

title: Alt Er Tabt
label: Paper Bag
description: Danish group's latest is a dark, tense record full of spartan arrangements and songs built more around moody atmosphere than melodic hooks.

title: In and Out and Back Again
label: HoZac
description: Amidst the slew of Velvets/Spacemen 3-indebted garage-drone bands around, Woven Bones continue to come closest to capturing the right mood.

title: Rhizomes
label: Sacred Bones
description: Brooklyn band recalls the experimental, krautock-inspired spirit of rhythmic post-punk, expertly synthesizing 15 years' worth of brooding, seismic rock.

title: False Flag
label: Drag City
description: This out-rock supergroup featuring Sir Richard Bishop (Sun City Girls), Ben Chasny (Six Organs of Admittance), and Chris Corsano doesn't disappoint.

title: Infinite Arms
label: Fat Possum
description: Jumping from Sub Pop to a major-- and featuring a revamped lineup around linchpin Ben Bridwell-- Band of Horses return for album No. 3

title: Wounded Lion
label: In the Red
description: L.A. group's offbeat humor comes off as more honest and unguarded than their garage and lo-fi peers', but without the strong tunes to carry it.

title: Opal Island
label: Home Normal
description: Another in a recent wave of excellent drone artists-- Emeralds, Oneohtrix Point Never, and Black to Comm-- releases his latest LP.

title: The People's Record
label: Labrador
description: Versatile Swedish indie pop band branches out to add dense polyrhythms to their Euro-indie aesthetic.

title: A Small Turn of Human Kindness
label: Hydra Head
description: The Georgia sludge-merchants' latest has almost a black metal-style feeling of desolation to it-- slow and somber but still powerful.

title: This Is Happening
label: Virgin
description: On LCD's third LP, James Murphy applies his knowledge of post-punk and studio craft to remake 70s art-rock in his own hyper-modern, self-aware image.

title: Night Train EP
label: Interscope
description: Corny Coldplay copycats try to loosen up and project fun on their new EP. Feel-good MC K'naan guests, which actually makes sense.

title: New Slaves
label: Social Registry
description: The experimental Brooklyn band's latest is a satisfying descent into noisy chaos.

title: Blackjazz
label: The End
description: The acclaimed Norwegian avant-rock band splits the difference between jazz and metal while still transcending their influences.

title: Latin
label: Young Turks
description: Having solidified their lineup, this Toronto band's third album is leaner, funkier, and more consistent than its predecessors.

title: Treats
label: N.E.E.T.
description: The New York duo's debut full-length is a wildly fun noise-pop thrill-ride, delivering on the promise of last year's widely circulated demos.

title: Fabric 51
label: Fabric
description: The loose, low-slung disco found on the Get Physical proprietor's Fabric mix isn't up-to-the-minute, but it still resonates.

title: Warm Slime
label: In the Red
description: Prolific San Francisco psych band continues to make engagng bite-size garage-pop, like contemporaries Fresh & Onlys and Sic Alps.

title: The Adventures of Bobby Ray
label: Atlantic
description: Promising hip-hop star hits #1 with a compromised and creatively limp record. Thanks, major-label record industry.

title: No Singles
label: Polyvinyl
description: One of 2009's top new indie rock bands compiles two out-of-print EPs (2007's All Lies and 2008's Lullaby Death Jams).

title: Nothing Hurts
label: Sub Pop
description: Male Bonding's full-length debut cleans up the sound of their ultra lo-fi early singles but the music is still fast, noisy, and full of hooks.

title: The Bells
label: Erased Tapes
description: Erased Tapes-- home to Peter Broderick and Ólafur Arnalds, among others-- issues this piano improvisation work from Berlin-based composer Frahm.

title: Totaled
label: We Are Free
description: Houston-based psych band experiments with more song-oriented forms on its latest.

title: Feast of the Hunter's Moon
label: Sugar Hill
description: Three-fifths of the Decemberists joined with a few friends to form a string band specializing in bucolic Americana, bluegrass, and cowboy songs.

title: Here's to Taking It Easy
label: Dead Oceans
description: After his Willie Nelson-inspired record, Matthew Houck stays firmly in the world of country music rather than the wilderness folk he'd previously crafted.

title: Grey Oceans
label: Sub Pop
description: Hugely successful cult act continues to travel their own love/hate path, now for Sub Pop after years with Touch and Go.

title: Seedbed
label: Fan Death
description: Following quickly on a late 2009 12", Twin Stumps' latest is a more focused version of the band's grim, grimy, dread-filled post-hardcore.

title: Dettmann
label: Ostgut Ton
description: The Berlin DJ and producer releases his first LP, with tracks ranging from crisp minimal techno to more dubby and spacious excursions.

title: Boys Outside
label: Double Six
description: The Beta Band leader returns with his first record under his own name. Famed electronic craftsman Richard X produces.

title: Li(f)e
label: Anti-
description: The verbose indie-rapper recruits Califone as a backing band and collaborates with Chris Walla, Jason Lytle, and the late Mark Linkous on his new LP.

title: Sea of Cowards
label: Third Man
description: Jack White takes a stronger, more central role on the second Dead Weather album, sharing vocal duties almost evenly with Alison Mosshart.

title: Deep Tissue
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Side project of Oneida's Kid Millions and Bobby Matador works a psych rock vein similar to their main band but ramps up the minimalist repetition.

title: Wake Up the Nation
label: Yep Roc
description: The Jam and Style Council vet continues to display relevance and resilience on his latest solo record. Kevin Shields and ex-Jam cohort Bruce Foxton guest.

title: Where Did the Night Fall
label: Surrender All
description: Incredibly now going into its third decade, James Lavelle's resilient project reinvents itself as a workmanlike, electronically informed rock band.

title: At Echo Lake
label: Woodsist
description: Lo-fi heroes graduate to crafting country-inflected indie pop that's part Wowee Zowee and part Workingman's Dead.

title: High Violet
label: 4AD
description: Returning with a slightly darker and more ornate sound, the National remain masters of widescreen, emotionally engaging rock.

title: Cut and Run
label: Lovepump United
description: Brooklyn trio creates brutal prog à la Lightning Bolt or Orthrelm, but in consistently unexpected ways.

title: East General
label: Mexican Summer
description: Fucked Up's Ben Cook's side band issues its debut LP, which leans more to the "noise" end of "noise-pop" than contemporaries Sic Alps and Vivian Girls.

title: Liquid Love
label: Wall of Sound
description: The New York synth-pop duo have streamlined their sound, opting for lush, reassuring disco pulses reminiscent of late-era French house.

title: Honest Strings: A Tribute to the Life and Work of Jack Rose
label: Three Lobed
description: This gargantuan, online-only recording is an incredible testament to the life and career of the recently deceased acoustic guitar master Jack Rose.

title: Your Future Our Clutter
label: Domino
description: Mark E. Smith's veteran band teams with indie heavyweight label Domino for this lean, brute-force rock record.

title: In Evening Air
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Baltimore band mixes its own spin on new wave with highly charged drama courtesy of bellowing lead singer Samuel T. Herring.

title: Everyone Is a Ghost
label: Graveface
description: Slowdive guitarist Christian Savill's long-running project returns and sounds freshly energized.

title: The Dogs Are Parading
label: Interscope
description: Veteran producer and frequent Steven Soderbergh collaborator gathers his best work and his best remixes and obscurities.

title: Relayted
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Folkie and electro supergroup-- including Bon Iver, Megafaun, members of the Rosebuds, and leader Ryan Olson-- tackle 80s R&B and Lite FM fare.

title: Cosmogramma
label: Warp
description: The L.A. producer's head music, which pulls from jazz, hip-hop, videogame sounds, IDM, and more, is more dense and rewarding than ever.

title: Victorian America
label: Milan
description: California singer-songwriter mixes folky tales of woe delivered in a stripped-down setting with stately songs backed by lush arrangements.

title: A Little Big
label: Sound of a Handshake
description: Berlin-based F.S. Blumm continues to create understated, austere tunes, often in collaboration. Here he teams with Swedish singer Ellinor Blixt.

title: Bedford Park
label: Big Dada
description: Underground hip-hop agitator Mike Ladd brings back his Infesticons project for the third part of a high-concept trilogy.

title: More!
label: Get Physical
description: The famed Berlin techno duo return to their producer-centric roots after a one-album detour into crossover techno-pop.

title: Together
label: Matador
description: The Canadian supergroup continues its shift from urgent, high-velocity rave-ups to mid-tempo tunes with an ornate, cinematic grandeur.

title: Cracked Love & Other Drugs
label: Hardly Art
description: Steeped in Pac NW garage and punk, this wonderful Hardly Art band recalls everyone from the Wipers to the Fastbacks to Mudhoney.

title: Instant Coffee Baby / If You Leave It Alone
label: Moshi Moshi
description: UK outfit's latest is being released in the U.S. alongside a 2008 LP, introducing a promising band that brings to mind the wit of Art Brut.

title: A Book of Songs for Anne Marie
label: Drag City
description: Drag City's other harpist/pianist releases her intriguing second LP, which should earn her notice equal to that of her contemporaries.

title: Omni
label: Dangerbird
description: The indie rock veterans return with a slicker, more radio-friendly album that takes some troubling lyrical turns.

title: Heaven Is Whenever
label: Rough Trade
description: The Hold Steady attempt to balance widespread appeal while remaining embedded in the scenes they've been chronicling for half a decade.

title: MCMLXXX
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Sharing two members with Mahjongg, this Chicago trio crafts a conceptual album that's actively more enamored of the audience than itself.

title: A Balloon Called Moaning
label: Black Bell
description: Welsh band's mini-LP, out last year in the UK and now being issued in the States, demonstrates a flair for guitar anthems.

title: The Fear Is Excruciating, But Therein Lies the Answer
label: Sargent House
description: With conviction and character to spare, the post-rock band crafts another record of soft/loud dynamics.

title: Option Paralysis
label: Season of Mist
description: Blending technical metal and hardcore, the ambitious DEP try to avoid being pulled in too many stylistic directions.

title: Forgiveness Rock Record
label: Arts & Crafts
description: With production assistance from John McEntire, the Canadian indie rock kingpins return, tighter and more polished than ever.

title: Barefoot Wanderer
label: Bpitch Control
description: Multi-cultral dance act makes its BPitch debut, constructing songs from dancehall riddims, glitch-hop, and experimental techno.

title: You Never Did Anything Wrong to Me
label: Sonic Cathedral
description: Former member of M83 picks up where the dark shoegaze of Dead Cities, Red Seas & Lost Ghosts left off.

title: A Mishmash of Changing Moods
label: Traum Schallplatten
description: Preternaturally gifted Dutch techno producer quickly follows his impressive debut with another decent LP that could have been a great EP.

title: Paul's Tomb: A Triumph
label: Dead Oceans
description: Carey Mercer and co. follow 2007's triumphant Tears of the Valedictorian with another record of ambitious, high-wire indie rock.

title: Sun Bronzed Greek Gods EP
label: Burning Mill
description: Dom have only been a band for a few months, but they already display an innate understanding of the power of killer hooks-- their debut EP is packed with them.

title: Inter Arbiter
label: Twosyllable
description: Up and coming baroque-pop singer/songwriter flashes plenty of promise on his debut LP. Zach Condon (Beirut) and Angel Deradoorian (Dirty Projectors) guest.

title: Words Are Stupid
label: St. Ives
description: This extremely limited vinyl-only release is also the first since the sudden death of Black Swans member Noel Sayre.

title: Écailles de Lune
label: Prophecy
description: French artist Neige finally fits all his component parts-- arching atmospherics, celestial melodies, suffocating roars-- into one dynamic metal record.

title: My Best Friend Is You
label: Fiction
description: Following her Brit award-lauded UK #1 debut, the young singer-songwriter hasn't cracked up yet, but her sophomore album is thrillingly schizophrenic.

title: Crystal Castles
label: Fiction
description: Crystal Castles return with a second self-titled album, embracing a more direct pop sound while retaining the sharp edges that made their debut so compelling.

title: Little More Lived In
label: Makeshift Music
description: Memphis-by-way-of-Athens band drifts away from orchestral pop and incorporates more rootsy Southern flourishes.

title: Trans-Continental Hustle
label: American
description: Gogol Bordello again tackle overcoming stigmas against immigrants and America's favoring of bland homogenization. Rick Rubin produces.

title: What We Lose in the Fire We Gain in the Flood
label: Saddle Creek
description: Former Georgie James member takes a creative leap forward, trading polite, unmemorable indie pop for full-blown country and soul.

title: Voluspa
label: Brille
description: After a string of promising singles, and even better remixes, the blissed-out electro-pop group make their full-length debut.

title: DJ-Kicks
label: !K7
description: DFA mainstay builds off the massive success of his 2008 single "Happy House" by crafting the latest entry in the venerable DJ-Kicks mix series.

title: Thistled Spring
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: The PacNW band continues to trade in Southern gothic images and themes, adding more complexity and confidence to their sound.

title: Animal Feelings
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: The versatile songwriter/producer streamlines his spazz-pop approach and incorporates influences from modern R&B.

title: Daughters
label: Hydra Head
description: The final Daughters record finds the part of the group that went on to form Fang Island taking the lead, resulting in a more accessible version of the band.

title: Avi Buffalo
label: Sub Pop
description: Like the xx raised on a diet of Built to Spill and the Shins, Avi Buffalo are confident, deft, and lust-obsessed teens making music beyond their years.

title: Nobody's Daughter
label: Mercury
description: More than a decade after its last album, Courtney Love's band returns, and its leader attempts to prove she's more than a punchline.

title: III
label: Soft Abuse
description: The prolific, talented avant artist completes his "maximalist three-part suite" with its most diverse and engaging entry.

title: Guitar El Chark
label: Sublime Frequencies
description: One of the most legendary figures in Arabic music has the first official compilation of his work-- made in the mid-1970s-- released in the West.

title: Completely Removed
label: Dischord
description: D.C. band formed from the ashes of Faraquet take a turn toward melodic songcraft, and the new look suits them.

title: Streetlights
label: Interscope
description: After last year's lauded DJ Quik collab BlaQKout, the former Death Row mainstay finds a less fruitful partnership in Snoop producer Terrace Martin.

title: Clinging to a Scheme
label: Labrador
description: The Swedish indie pop group Radio Dept.'s third and best LP expands their sound palette with songs that sparkle with a glowing, sun-soaked ambiance.

title: Clay Stones
label: Manimal Vinyl
description: This L.A.-based electro pop outfit's menacing synths and treated vocals owe more than a little to the Knife's gothic techno.

title: The Day the Turf Stood Still
label: Sweetbreads Creative Collective
description: Bay Area rapper is making noise with his winning reinvention of not only his own area's sound, but NYC's as well.

title: Secret Agent
label: Nonesuch
description: The famed Afrobeat drummer, one of the pioneers of modern African music, makes his Nonesuch debut.

title: All Days are Nights: Songs for Lulu
label: Decca
description: The talented pop singer flirts with outright self-absorption on his latest record, a solo piano effort on which he bites off more than he can chew.

title: The Chaos
label: Nul
description: After a few records of unwelcome detours, the Futureheads mostly ditch the attempts at anthems and re-embrace some of their eccentricities.

title: The Endtables
label: Drag City
description: Drag City unearths yet another worthwhile nugget from the post-punk vault, compiling the work of a group that sounded like an off-kilter Buzzcocks.

title: Lux
label: Kranky
description: Chicago band that includes members of the Ponys and Boas brings its jagged rock mix from Touch and Go to Kranky.

title: Kush and Orange Juice
label: Unknown
description: Without a major label deal or superstar allegiances, Wiz has turned himself into a hip-hop star by rapping about weed, girls, and smoking weed with girls.

title: Travellers in Space and Time
label: Elephant Six
description: The E6 vets continue their welcome comeback with an album that pairs the usual ELO/Wings pop with dancier, looser tunes.

title: Subiza
label: True Panther
description: The band whose Ayrton Senna EP helped define last summer's bright, beachy sound gains momentum with a beautifully surging, shimmering trance-pop LP.

label: Last Gang
description: Garage-rock fixture-- whether as BBQ Show, an Almighty Defender, or any of his other numerous projects-- releases a rare LP under his own name.

title: Ear Drums and Black Holes
label: Planet µ
description: On his second album, Starkey amplifies his gift for matching melodic complexity to forceful rhythms, every bass-heavy beat matched to a soulful melody.

title: Thing
label: Thrill Jockey
description: The long-running electro-rock band seems over its dull patch from a few years ago, continuing the bump in quality evinced on 2007's Sex Change.

title: The Incredible String Band / The 5000 Spirits or the Layers of the Onion / The Hangman's Beautiful Daughter / Wee Tam and the Big Huge
label: Fledg'ling
description: The UK folk group's first four LPs are reissued.

title: I See the Sign
label: Bedroom Community
description: This thoroughly modern folk singer continues his stunning recreations of classic folk, with help from Ben Frost, Nico Muhly, and Beth Orton.

title: The Outsiders Are Back
label: Luaka Bop
description: Along with Sharon Jones, Lee Fields, and Charles Walker's Dynamites, here's another worthy entry in the 21st century soul revival.

title: Where Is the Truth
label: City Centre Offices
description: Former Seefeel man returns at a time when the woozily psychedelic synth-pop he helped pioneer is back in style.

title: Righteous Fists of Harmony
label: Brainfeeder
description: The prolific L.A.-based beatmaker releases a new EP for Flying Lotus' Brainfeeder imprint.

title: A Coming of Age
label: Ruffa Lane
description: One of the most dynamic indie pop and pre-Beatles throwbacks around follows their excellent 2007 debut, The Great Unwanted.

title: Swim
label: Merge
description: After drawing from IDM, krautrock, and sunshine pop, Dan Snaith's project sets its sights on dark and intricate dance music, with dazzling results.

title: It All Falls Apart
label: Ghostly
description: This Gas-influenced ambient composer teams with an ex-Slowdive member and displays more personality on his latest Ghostly International LP.

title: WHB
label: Naïve
description: London dance-punk band with a bit of online buzz offers up their full-length debut.

title: LeftBack
label: Hall of Justus
description: This is supposedly the final chapter for Phonte and Pooh's often divisive group, self-proclaimed keepers of the true hip-hop flame.

title: La La Land
label: Secret City
description: Montreal band follows its underrated 2008 Laurel Canyon-like debut Parc Avenue with a more plugged-in, boisterous record.

title: City of Daughters / Thief / Streethawk: A Seduction
label: Merge
description: Remastered and reissued editions document Dan Bejar's early period, when he grew into the unique, beloved songwriter he is today.

title: Sucker
label: Goner
description: The eccentric Memphis singer-songwriter and former Cat Power collaborator again crafts narratives tinged with insight and humor.

title: Steal Your Face
label: Thrill Jockey
description: San Fran trio crafts almost overwhelmingly intense music; stick with its guitar savagery, dub textures, and ricocheting rhythms-- you'll be glad you did.

title: Initiate
label: Cryptogramophone
description: Wilco's Cline leads one of his may other projects through two discs-- one live, one studio-- of unpredictable electronic rock-ish jazz.

title: The Burrrprint (2)
label: Warner Bros.
description: Gucci's record released while incarcerated; despite the name-- the sequel to his best 2009 tape-- it's being treated as much as an LP as a mixtape.

title: Rough Travel for a Rare Thing
label: Drag City
description: Bill Callahan's first live album, recorded in 2007, is a 2xLP/download set that captures one of this era's best singer-songwriters in amazing form.

title: Goodbye Falkenburg
label: Fantastic Plastic
description: Welsh band with a flair for music hall, psychedelia, glam rock, and post-punk craft a debut that is both ambitious and immediate.

title: Las Vênus Resort Palace Hotel
label: Crammed Discs
description: Brazilian singer pays tribute to the untrendy sounds of exotica, searching for beauty in the stylized approximations outsiders have made of her culture.

title: ForNever
label: SMC
description: After a lukewarmly received major-label record, Murs retreats into a more familiar headspace with frequent collaborator 9th Wonder.

title: City of Straw
label: Brah
description: New York trio continues to explore minimalism and white-hot noise, a fierce blend of seemingly disparate elements.

title: The Wild Hunt
label: Dead Oceans
description: Swedish troubadour Kristian Matsson returns as a more confident vocalist and a more nuanced and effective songwriter.

title: Wooden Blankets EP
label: Kanine
description: Animal Collective acolytes continue to grow and escape the shadow of their influences on their new EP.

title: Contact, Love, Want, Have
label: Hyperdub
description: A rare full length from Hyperdub, Ikonika's debut is an exciting extension of post-dubstep styles like wonky, funky, and chiptunes.

title: Prior to the Fire
label: Tee Pee
description: After parting ways with RCA, the stoner-metal band regroups and releases their second album the way they intended people to hear it in the first place.

title: Prins Thomas
label: Full Pupp
description: Space disco mainstay and frequent Lindstrøm partner records a solo record inspired by 1970s German music and avant-garde composition.

title: Raw Power [Legacy Edition] / Raw Power [Deluxe Edition]
label: Legacy
description: One of the greatest rock albums ever is reissued again, this time in two versions; both useful but less than ideal or definitive.

title: Speculation
label: Domino
description: Berlin post-rockers play nice with a member of Krautrock legends Faust and discover a looser sound.

title: Heart That's Pounding
label: Arts & Crafts
description: Artist formerly known as New Buffalo-- and the co-author of Feist's "1234"-- traffics again in wistful, just-eccentric-enough indie pop.

title: Gute Luft
label: Kompakt
description: The versatile German producer returns with music created for a documentary, and the set serves as an excellent survey of his range.

title: Shame, Shame
label: Anti-
description: After a gruelingly long run of 1960s rock fetishism and dry, indistinguishable material, Dr. Dog embrace a bigger, more charismatic sound.

title: True Love Cast Out All Evil
label: Anti-
description: The inimitable veteran rocker teams with fellow Texans Okkervil River on a record that gathers ideas and songs crafted over the past 40 years.

title: White Hills
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Thrill Jockey debut from this space-rock band adds urgency to familiar psych-rock templates while displaying a careful layering of sounds and atmospheres.

title: Small Black EP
label: Jagjaguwar
description: The band currently touring with kindred spirit Washed Out supplements their 2009 EP with two additional tracks in a remastered edition on Jagjaguwar.

title: Slave Riot
label: Stones Throw
description: Madlib again displays his near-unparalleled ear on this smoldering homage to the independent-minded, freewheeling jazz of the 1960s and early 70s.

title: One One
label: Accidental
description: The post-modern music maker limits his contextual sampling to a single subject: himself.

title: Congratulations
label: Columbia
description: MGMT follow the surprise hit Oracular Spectacular by teaming with Spacemen 3's Sonic Boom for a leftfield psych-pop LP bereft of obvious singles.

title: Escape
label: Woodsist
description: Woodsist presents the first full-length from this krautrock-indebted collaboration featuring Wooden Shijps guitarist Erik "Ripley" Johnson.

title: Tommy
label: Anticon
description: Stretching his legs beyond his folktronica wheelhouse, Dosh's latest album is a compelling glimpse of potential things to come. Andrew Bird guests.

title: The Bundles
label: K
description: Kimya Dawson and Jeffrey Lewis collect some tunes crafted when they first met nearly 10 years ago, fleshed out with a few recent stragglers.

title: High Places vs. Mankind
label: Thrill Jockey
description: On their second proper LP, High Places move from the wispy optimism that characterized their early work, opting for a darker sound to suit more solemn songs.

title: Wu-Massacre
label: Def Jam
description: Three of Wu-Tang's top MCs show up together on this 30-minute LP for three whole songs, padding out the rest with skits and guest verses.

title: Bubu King
label: True Panther
description: The Sierra Leone-born singer releases a short but satisfying EP containing his native country's minimal and hypnotic bubu music.

title: Extra Wow
label: Warp
description: Portland duo's first Warp album maintains their previous work's eclecticism but aims for a more cohesive listen with a relentlessly sunny, psychedelic feel.

title: No Mas
label: Luaka Bop
description: Mixing electro, funk, world music, and early hip-hop, Javelin made waves with mixtapes and singles; now, via Luaka Bop, they offer their scrubbed-up debut LP.

title: The Dark Leaves
label: Altitude
description: The New York-based singer/songwriter releases his eighth full-length, and first since 2007's Last Light.

title: Here Lies Love
label: Nonesuch
description: The Talking Head and A-list dance producer gather 22 vocalists-- including Santigold, Tori Amos, and Florence Welch-- for a tribute to Imelda Marcos. Really.

title: Skulltaste
label: Ghostly
description: Post-hip-hop producer creates an album whose sonic multiple-personality disorder could be aggravating if it weren't so consistently engaging.

title: PUMPS!
label: Vice
description: Former duo adds a third member, shifting the balance of their focus from tones graced by rhythms to rhythms graced by tones.

title: Vol. 2
label: Sick Thirst
description: The San Francisco band issues a second set of odds and ends, demonstrating how it streamlines multiple strains of psychedelic rock.

title: Unfun
label: Blackball
description: Influential San Francisco punk band's bracing 1990 debut full-length is remastered and, on digital versions, paired with the 1989 Whack & Blite EP.

title: The Places Between: The Best of Doves
label: EMI
description: The former "new Radiohead" has their best moments-- most of them from their first two LPs-- packaged with other highlights, and the requisite new song.

title: New Love
label: self-released
description: Minneapolis producer's self-released debut makes up for a lack of envelope-pushing with a fine-tuned ear for cratedigger-friendly 1970s soul jazz.

title: ...And Then We Saw Land
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Weirdo UK folk band gets a lot less weirdo on its latest album, sounding here like skewed pastoral groups the Beta Band and the Incredible String Band.

title: The Predicate (Dub Version)
label: Stones Throw
description: Prefuse 73's Scott Herren remixes a Stones Throw release credited to the Predicate Production Guild-- which may also be Herren himself.

title: Hippies
label: Matador
description: A garage band as steeped in Pixies as Nuggets, Harlem's Matador debut is filled with bubblegum choruses flavored with booze and cigarettes.

title: New Amerykah Part Two: Return of the Ankh
label: Motown
description: After the fury of the stunning New Amerykah Part One, Badu returns to creating relaxed, personal funk that feels more like a sketchbook than a record.

title: No Rest
label: Klangbad
description: Classically trained pianist and self-taught indie guitarist find middle ground through a shared sense of experimentation.

title: The Law of Large Numbers
label: Chemikal Underground
description: Delgados singer operates outside of her orchestral pop comfort zone, improving on her solo debut.

title: NonStopErotik
label: Cooking Vinyl
description: Pixies singer and guitarist continues his prolific solo career, again connecting his current output with his formative work.

title: I Learned the Hard Way
label: Daptone
description: The latest from these funk/soul throwbacks further affirms the validity of working in specific styles, even ones most people stopped exploring decades ago.

title: Go
label: XL
description: The Sigur Rós singer fights huge with huger on his solo debut, matching the uplift of his full-time band at their most dramatic.

title: Future Factory
label: Three Ring
description: Ambitious, under-the-radar indie rock band returns to form blending Brit Invasion pop with elements of Krautrock and bossa nova.

title: Outbursts
label: Cooking Vinyl
description: It's the return of Turin Brakes, back with more dewy lead guitar and dewy lyrics.

title: Triangulation
label: Hotflush
description: The steward of the almost bulletproof Hotflush label, home to nominally dubstep breakouts by Mount Kimbie and Joy Orbison, issues his excellent second LP.

title: I Speak Because I Can
label: Astralwerks
description: Just out of her teens, promising UK songwriter starts to come into her own on her second album, a top five success in her home country.

title: The Wonder Show of the World
label: Drag City
description: Will Oldham pairs with guitarist/Cairo Gang chief Emmett Kelly to explore how we tangle ourselves with each other-- as friends, parents, children, spouses.

title: Machines That Listen
label: Lefse
description: The Delta Mirror's debut for Lefse works from an unusual concept: Each of its nine tracks takes place in a different room of a hospital.

title: Holy Broken
label: Shrug
description: The project of former Red Red Meat bassist Tim Hurley continues writing interesting twists into his former band's noisy Americana legacy.

title: Our Inventions
label: Morr
description: On its first album in five years, the German electro-pop band that includes Markus Acher from the Notwist continues to refine its icy style.

title: Black Tambourine
label: Slumberland
description: Black Tambourine's sound is all over the contemporary lo-fi scene, and this reissue shows why it has endured.

title: Sisterworld Reinterpretations
label: Mute
description: Liars' bracingly physical rock is given the remix/covers treatment by Thom Yorke, TV on the Radio's Tunde Adebimpe, and Atlas Sound, among others.

title: Wrestling Moves
label: Sargent House
description: Indiana post-hardcore band with proggy leanings release their debut full-length.

title: Endless Falls
label: Kranky
description: Ambient vet Scott Morgan breathes new life into the Loscil project, playing with the idea of water-as-sound and pulling it off. Destroyer's Dan Bejar guests.

title: Mimicking Birds
label: Glacial Pace
description: This spectral folk/home recording project from Portland's Nate Lacy was produced by the songwriter's psuedo-mentor, Modest Mouse's Isaac Brock.

title: Nolens Volens
label: self-released
description: L.A. band rebounds from falling off the hype machine with a more direct, foreboding, and ultimately better second LP.

title: I Will Be
label: Sub Pop
description: Former lo-fi star Dee Dee hires a full band and co-producer Richard Gottehrer, making this Sub Pop LP both terrifically fun and occasionally ferocious.

title: White Mystery
label: Unknown
description: Chicago garage-rock fixture Alex White forms a drums-guitar duo with her brother to craft a whipsmart record with an almost perverse sense of pride.

title: Africa
label: Now Again
description: This 1975 record from Zambia's "Zam-rock" scene, reissued by Now-Again and Shadoks, shows a band that was both behind and ahead of its era.

title: Color Your Life
label: Infinite Best
description: Young NYC band continues to grow on its dynamic second EP, which recalls everything from Stereolab to Björk to Cocteau Twins.

title: Tomorrow Is Alright
label: Soft Abuse
description: Like citymates Girls, this group of San Fran all-stars matches wry, easygoing tunes with a far-reaching pastiche of vintage trappings.

title: Today / On Fire / This Is Our Music
label: Domino
description: The brilliant and influential dream-pop band's three studio albums have been reissued again, this time in 2xCD sets.

title: Love & Desperation
label: Tee Pee
description: Cobra Verde's John Petkovic leads a band featuring J Mascis through takes on 70s arena rock and hard-luck tales.

title: And in the Endless Pause There Came the Sound of Bees
label: Type
description: Consistently outstanding Icelandic composer and producer creates the soundtrack for a film about rodents that doubles as a well-done eco-parable.

title: The Illustrated Garden
label: Merge
description: Jim Putnam re-tools his band's lineup and tweaks its name on the Americana group's latest in a string of Merge releases.

title: Mulatu Steps Ahead
label: Strut
description: The veteran Ethiopian bandleader works with Heliocentrics and Boston's Either/Orchestra to craft a loose and improvisational winner.

title: Roman Candle / From a Basement on the Hill
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: Elliott Smith's first and last albums are reissued, highlighting the remarkable progression of his sadly brief career.

title: Live Recordings, TV-Clips & Roadmovie
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: This 2xCD release unarchives a few moments from the Swiss punk band's past: a Kleenex set from 1979, a LiLiPUT one from '83, unreleased songs, and a DVD.

title: Lux
label: Hum+Haw
description: Latest from the Scottish producer whose dark, ornate music seems at odds with electronic music fashion in the best possible way.

title: Dear Companion
artist: Ben Sollee and Daniel Martin Moore
label: Sub Pop
description: My Morning Jacket's Jim James coaxes a modern sound from traditional roots on an album about the ecological challenges facing the trio's old Kentucky home.

title: Missing Deadlines: Selected Remixes
label: Rocket Girl
description: A dreamy haze runs across this shoegaze-minded producer's remix collection, for better or worse.

title: Under Great White Northern Lights
label: Warner Bros.
description: This lavish box set-- a live DVD, CD, documentary film, and book-- reinforces the White Stripes' mythology and displays the awesome power of their live show.

title: The Optimist
label: The Numbers
description: Dance-rock stars of minor blog hits like "Ice Cream" and "The Bomb" return with another stab at capturing the aloof cool of Ladytron.

title: Sleep Mountain
label: Bella Union
description: Once a nervy indie rock band à la British Sea Power, the Kissaway Trail here is basically a Scandinavian Arcade Fire.

title: Manifesto
label: Traffic Entertainment
description: The Wu-Tang MC returns with his first full-length in four years. Kurupt, Raekwon, and Cappadonna guest.

title: Two Thousand and Ten Injuries
label: Polyvinyl
description: Disco beats, post-punk sax honking, twee-pop boy/girl harmonies, and lyrics that rip your heart out. Yep, Love Is All is back.

title: Head First
label: Mute
description: Bringing roller-disco synth-pop out of mothballs gives the UK duo their most entertaining album since electro-glam juggernaut Supernature.

title: A
label: Ecstatic Peace
description: Massachusetts out-rock collective again teams with Four Tet, who turns them into an ethereal, electronic version of themselves.

title: Everyday Balloons
label: Team Love
description: Portland band effectively translates its once-acoustic slowcore to electric arrangements, with help from producer Adam Selzer (Decemberists, M. Ward)

title: S-M 2: Abyss in B Minor
label: 4AD
description: Scandinavian group finally drops a follow up to its debut, with Sufjan once again adding barely perceptible instrumental flourishes to the general maelstrom.

title: Dirty Shirt Rock 'n' Roll: The First Ten Years
label: Shout! Factory
description: This survey of the JSBX's first decade holds together remarkably well and gives a good sense of the band's visceral appeal.

title: One Jug of Wine, Two Vessels
label: Saddle Creek
description: Conor Oberst resurrects the Bright Eyes moniker on this reissue, which adds four newly recorded tracks.

title: Invisible Violence
description: Montreal dance-punk band mellows out on its latest, and along the way seems to have lost some of its sense of self.

title: Alex Bleeker and the Freaks
label: Underwater Peoples
description: Real Estate member gathers his bandmaters and friends for a low-key classic rock-like record about spring, summer, and hanging out.

title: Raw Cuts, Vol. 1
label: Faces
description: Stuttgart's Danilo Plessow gathers three 12"'s (and three exclusives) that often sound like dance created by and for people who love dusty, 1990s hip-hop.

title: In the Court of the Wrestling Let's
label: Merge
description: The members of this London rock band are barely out of their teens, which helps explain their uncanny knack for articulating the pain of youth.

title: Greenberg OST
label: Parlophone
description: On this soundtrack for a new Noah Baumbach-Ben Stiller film, LCD's James Murphy shows his singer-songwriter side, often making like Harry Nilsson.

title: Chant Darling
label: Bella Union
description: Bella Union uproots another 60s pop-loving artist, releasing the U.S. debut from James Milne, who has played with the Ruby Suns and Okkervil River.

title: Kings Ballad
label: Ubiquity
description: Spiritual singer/producer refocuses for a deeper, more rooted release.

title: This Is Still It
label: Acute
description: A striking collection from the 1980s Athens, Ga., band, which came up in the same scene as R.E.M., the B-52's, and Pylon.

title: Oversteps
label: Warp
description: Warp mainstays and techno pioneers pivot slightly with an album of dark ambience and intriguing textures.

title: Volume Two
label: Merge
description: Zooey Deschanel and M. Ward refine and improve their sound, creating a sequel that actually improves on the original.

title: Fly Yellow Moon
label: Geffen
description: Guillemots singer trades his band's stylistic adventurousness and avant-garde impulses for the direct simplicity of 1970s singer-songwriter stuff.

title: Rough Frame EP
label: Woodsist
description: Woodsist continues to explore San Fran's ascendant art-pop scene, here releasing lo-fi indie pop from a duo featuring Glenn Donaldson (Skygreen Leopards).

title: Settings EP
label: True Panther
description: Former Prof Murder and Don Cab guys continue to impress with tropical synth-pop that sounds more like Tough Alliance and AnCo than their former acts.

title: The Martyrdom of a Catastrophist
label: Mylene Sheath
description: Boston band inspired by the darker end of new wave crafts an engaging concept album about a fringe scientist.

title: jj n° 3
label: Secretly Canadian
