description: Cosmopolitan Swedish group follows a record that took cues from Balearic dance, bookish indie pop, and hip-hop into a heavy-lidded stunner.

title: Masks EP
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Baltimore trio and Wham City vets bash out often-funny anthems that recall post-punk and alternative rock heroes.

title: Be Brave
label: Rough Trade
description: This raucous Austin band's second album dials back some of the garage rock intensity in favor of introspective songs with a more emotional tug.

title: Sweet Sister EP
label: Banter
description: The North Carolina band's studio work grows increasingly intricate, even here on a self-produced follow-up to their major label debut.

title: Massa Hypnos
label: Ecstatic Peace
description: Ecstatic Peace! band continues to mine sludgy Detroit rock like the Stooges and the Nuge, and now mines classic indie rock as well.

title: Stuck on Nothing
label: Astralwerks
description: James Murphy-produced DFA band bottles the wide-eyed, wild-haired feeling that galvanized Richard Linklater's Dazed and Confused.

title: Polaroid Piano
label: Someone Good
description: Japanese composer crafts a wistful and gorgeous meditation for minimal piano and field recordings.

title: Message From the Tribe: An Anthology of Tribe Records 1972-1976
label: Universal Sound
description: Soul Jazz reissues the work of this Detroit jazz collective, most striking for its eclectic, without-borders approach.

title: Happy Birthday
label: Sub Pop
description: Sub Pop group marries two of the PacNW's great musical legacies-- twee and grunge-- with surprisingly great effect.

title: Weathervanes
label: Frenchkiss
description: Frenchkiss, lately locating quality bands with commercial appeal (Passion Pit, Antlers, Dodos, Local Natives), here offers a crappy one with commercial appeal.

title: Big Echo
label: Rough Trade
description: San Fran baroque-pop group takes a nice step forward on its sophomore album, thanks in part to pristine production from Grizzly Bear's Chris Taylor.

title: Gay Singles
label: Matador
description: True Panther collects 7" tracks released over the past few years by Seth Bogart's homoerotic, rock'n'roll throwbacks.

title: Wildling
label: Staubgold
description: Tough-to-peg band mixes jazz, classic German psychedelia (think Cluster), and a bendy guitar style familiar from spaghetti Westerns.

title: Who Killed Sgt. Pepper?
label: A
description: The latest from Anton Newcombe's band finds him attempting to revitalize BJM's sound with disco rhythms, drum loops, and house-diva wails.

title: Are the Roaring Night
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Montreal band delivers an edgy, restless set of dark romanticism and muscular guitar.

title: The Big To-Do
label: ATO
description: The DBTs return, focusing on the songwriting of Patterson Hood and refreshingly reconnecting with the macabre and darker corners of the American psyche.

title: PVI006/IBB004
label: Italian Beach Babes
description: This oddly titled compilation rounds up a group of kindred UK garage-rock spirits-- led by Male Bonding, Teen Sheiks, and Spectrals-- quietly making noise.

title: Shaved EP
label: Warp
description: Vancouver artist makes his Warp debut on an EP of ominous mood pieces and dubstep-esque excursions he calls "surf-step."

title: Lay of Pilgrim Park
label: Empty Cellar
description: Using just vocals and a small array of traditionally classical instruments, this Chicago band conjures their own unique sound.

title: Rush to Relax
label: Melodic
description: Fantastic Australian garage-punk band continues its quick rise on this hastily made but powerfully packed new album.

title: Fang Island
label: Sargent House
description: This wildly infectious Brooklyn band takes manic musicianship and shoutalong choruses to another level on their self-titled second album.

title: Nigeria Special, Vol. 2: Modern Highlife, Afro Sounds & Nigerian Blues 1970-6
label: Soundway
description: Soundway's second Nigeria Special volume gives us a glimpse of what highlife sounded like in Africa's most populous nation during the early 1970s.

title: Be So True EP
label: Arcade Sound
description: Another rising chillwave producer, South Florida's MillionYoung creates music that's more synthetic than most current bedroom electronic projects.

title: The Desert of Shallow Effects
label: Majordomo
description: After six years of almost complete silence, the former Beulah frontman delivers his solo debut to a cult in waiting.

title: Carve Out the Face of My God
label: Post Present Medium
description: Sophomore LP from this L.A. noise artist is bolder and more fully realized than his debut, with almost every shoegazey glow countered by a noisy growl.

title: The Monitor
label: XL
description: Titus' sophomore record, a sprawling concept album loosely about the U.S. Civil War, is packed with anthems and brimming with energy and ambition.

title: Return to Form
label: Drag City
description: At their best, this fantastic live band combines tight riffs and chops with a deep, abiding love of joyous guitar slop.

title: Home Acres
label: Polyvinyl
description: Aloha continue to invest in woeful tales of anti-social sadsacks set to a pristine mix of Chicago indie-prog and late-90s emo.

title: Kairos
label: Dead Oceans
description: Casey Dienel's restless voice detours again on an enveloping album of artful, gauzy pop.

title: Stridulum EP
label: Sacred Bones
description: Following on their stirring full-length debut, The Spoils, Zola Jesus return with a terrific EP that applies their gothic drama to more immediate songs.

title: Broken Bells
label: Columbia
description: The Shins' James Mercer teams with producer and Gnarls Barkley member Danger Mouse for a melancholy pop record.

label: Kanine
description: Led by a touring guitarist from Titus Andronicus, Dinowalrus create rapidly shifting songs that leap from spazzy guitar-pop to skronky noise.

title: Land of Make Believe
label: Duckdown
description: Backpacker latecomers shift to make a record that picks up the Kid Cudi rap-pop baton.

title: Strange Keys to Untune Gods' Firmament
label: Neurot
description: UK band creates an engrossing 12-track, 2xCD, two-hour-plus marathon of feedback-and-distortion charges for electric guitar and electronics.

title: Beat the Devil's Tattoo
label: Abstract Dragon
description: One of the original progenitors of the early-2000s "rock is back" ethos reckons with making music well after their original battles have been fought.

title: Plastic Beach
label: Virgin
description: Ex-Blur frontman Damon Albarn ditches the idea of writing pop songs a cartoon band might front and makes one of his most gorgeous pop records in years.

title: Wierd Presents: Cold Waves and Minimal Electronics, Vol. 1
label: Angular
description: A satisfying collection of the obscure synth-based music that drew from post-punk and early new wave in a decidedly low-budget and DIY style.

title: Double Jointer
label: Hardly Art
description: Hardly Art band's debut falls in line with the throwback garage-rock of Black Lips and King Khan, as well as the murkier scuzz-pop of Vivian Girls.

title: In Stereo
label: Mego
description: Viennese laptop guru Christian Fennesz, British electronic wizard Peter Rehberg, and American multi-tasker Jim O'Rourke reunite for a third record.

title: The Brutalist Bricks
label: Matador
description: After the slight letdown of Living With the Living, Ted Leo's new LP is hopeful, purposeful, direct-- an improvement on every level.

title: Sisterworld
label: Mute
description: Liars' relentlessly tense new album finds the always excellent band focusing on detail and texture rather than stylistic schizophrenia.

title: Time on a String
label: Sounds Familyre
description: Produced by Daniel Smith, the debut from this deeply mannered singer finds her backed by members of her family.

title: Between Buildings and Trees
label: Kompakt
description: Kompakt ambient artist collects patient piano melodies and loops and crafts a quiet, delicate winner.

title: Nerve Up
label: Warp
description: Manchester singer/guitarist Julie Campbell proves the post-punk revival isn't a spent force on this, her debut LP for Warp.

title: The Winter of Mixed Drinks
label: Fat Cat
description: Frightened Rabbit's third studio LP finds them with a bigger, more sophisticated sound to match their newly-expanded band and a slightly sunnier outlook.

title: Quarantine the Past
label: Matador
description: The first career-spanning Pavement comp contains their best-known songs as well as concert staples, fan favorites, and at least a couple of curveballs.

title: Hologram Jams
label: Fat Possum
description: These former Blood Brothers are now a duo with a stronger dance-rock flavor; somewhere along the line, something went very wrong.

title: Lights
label: Polydor
description: Hailed as a UK buzz artist for her blend of folk and pop sensibility, this newcomer is more akin to Scandinavians Lykke Li and Jenny Wilson.

title: Jet Lag
label: Anticon
description: The WHY? drummer and brother of Yoni Wolf steps out with a solo LP inspired by a breakup.

title: Fight Softly
label: Sub Pop
description: A louder, thicker album from New Zealand-based outfit known for combining live instruments and samples in a swirl of psychedelic color.

title: Oar
label: self-released
description: Beck continues his inspired work leading famous friends in covers of older albums. Wilco, Feist, Jamie Lidell here help him tackle Skip Spence's cult classic.

title: Nigeria Afrobeat Special: The New Explosive Sound in 1970s Nigeria
label: Soundway
description: The fifth volume in Soundway's Nigeria Special turns its attention to Afrobeat proper, featuring both Fela Kuti and just some of those indebted to him.

title: Draumalandid
label: Bedroom Community
description: Famed Icelandic producer (Björk, Will Oldham) and Bedroom Community boss soundtracks an environmental doc. Sam Amidon, Nico Muhly, and Ben Frost guest.

title: Constellations
label: Western Vinyl
description: Austin instrumental ensemble demands patience and attention on this, their best record to date.

title: In the Dark
label: ATO
description: The Athens rockers' third album, produced by Ben Allen, finds them a long way from their scrappy beginnings.

title: A Sufi and a Killer
label: Warp
description: Working with producers including Flying Lotus and Gaslamp Killer, vocalist Gonjasufi has created a fascinating slab of hallucinogenic head-nod music.

title: Back to Light
label: !K7
description: UK producer Tim Simenon continues his comeback as Bomb the Bass, here roping in Gui Boratto as co-producer. Martin Gore and Kelley Polar guest.

title: Elevator Music, Vol. 1 / Sub:stance
label: Fabric
description: A pair of compilations-- one from Fabric, one from Scuba's Berlin club-- that serve as mini-anthropologies of dubstep in 2010.

title: Going Places
label: Type
description: Famed noise/drone duo issue their final record, which transforms a sense of finality and reflection into often incredible instrumental passages.

title: Permalight
label: Brushfire
description: After a run of bad luck and tragedy, Rogue Wave reconvene for their second post-Sub Pop album.

title: The Creatures in the Garden of Lady Walton / Veil Waltz EP
label: Brassland
description: The National's Bryce Dessner's post-rockers return, now focusing on songcraft. Shara Worden frequently guests; Matt Berninger and Sufjan Stevens also appear.

title: Descending Shadows
label: Vice
description: Veteran PacNW garage rockers Fred and Toody Cole, formerly of Dead Moon, record their second LP (and first for Vice).

title: Coconut
label: Domino
description: Marking a transition between their garage rock roots and a new DFA-esque friendly sound, the UK band deliver a record of two very different sides.

title: Close Calls With Brick Walls / Mother of Mankind
label: Steev Mike
description: The once Far East-only-- frequently awesome; sometimes experimental-- Close Calls LP is finally released in the U.S., along with a bonus record.

title: Rat a Tat Tat
label: Arts & Crafts
description: Broken Social Scenester displays a welcome command of songcraft in an indie-folk field that too often is all about vocals and words.

title: Ladies and Gentlemen We are Floating in Space [Collector's Editon]
label: ATP
description: This new deluxe, limited product is only for hardcore fans; the music, however-- both the original LP and this record's extras-- is timeless.

title: Yeah So
label: Moshi Moshi
description: Sheffield boy-girl duo nail precious, vulnerable feelings over the course of their sweet (but not twee or saccharine) indie pop debut.

title: Mathematics Presents: Return of Wu and Friends
label: Gold Dust Media
description: The sequel to the Wu family record nobody wanted in the first place explores the post-The W, pre-8 Diagrams Wu dead zone.

title: Snakes for the Divine
label: E1
description: Five albums in and another awesome, absolutely pummeling record of tough, fast stoner metal from Matt Pike and co.

title: Nitetime Rainbows EP
label: Mis Ojos Discos
description: Ambitious Philly band follow their hour-plus opus Ashes Grammar with a second example of what their new-look band sounds like.

title: Tomorrow, in a Year
label: Mute
description: The prominent electro group releases an avant-garde opera about the life of Charles Darwin that's at times impenetrable and rapturous.

title: Trilogi
label: Kora
description: Swedish folk band collects three limited-edition EPs onto a record that has a sneaky, consistent sound that's immediate and yet full of surprises.

title: Maintenant
label: Tomlab
description: Long-gestating LP recalls the recent soft-pop of Lucky Soul or Camera Obscura, but with guest vocalists that include Owen Pallett, Mirah, and Rose Melberg.

title: Magic Chairs
label: 4AD
description: Danish band, who has often intrigued and wowed in the past, chart a more direct path, preferring pop clarity over musical intrigue.

title: Watergate 05
label: Watergate
description: Berlin techno linchpin contributes to her hometown club's mix series, featuring tracks by Röyksopp, Matias Aguayo, Luciano, AGF, and Uffie.

title: Dear God, I Hate Myself
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: With Caralee McElroy gone, Jamie Stewart enlists new guests and experiments with 8-bit textures. It's still Xiu Xiu though: look at the title.

title: Landing
label: Swim~
description: Wire's Colin Newman and co. keep their original sound-- reminiscent of their first band and very early Stereolab-- mostly intact on album three.

title: Eyelid Movies
label: Barsuk
description: An aptly titled debut record from a duo with a penchant for lush, moody, and surprisingly affecting trip-hop.

title: The Magician's Private Library
label: XL
description: Rising singer-songwriter explores nightmares, hopes, and loss on her debut album. TV on the Radio's Dave Sitek produces.

title: Work
label: Merge
description: On their follow-up to 2007's Our Ill Wills, the Swedish band enlists Phil Ek to beef up and sharpen their twee-leaning sound.

title: American Recordings VI: Ain't No Grave
label: American
description: The supposed final chapter in the late country star's career-capping sessions with producer Rick Rubin is released and fashioned as a tearjerker.

title: Introducing
label: Slumberland
description: New noise-pop band fits perfectly into the Slumberland Records aesthetic: washes of reverb, bubblegum melodies, and shoestring-budget production.

title: Minor Love
label: Fat Possum
description: The former Moldy Peaches member eschews dick jokes and pop ditties for Downtown cool and minimalism.

title: Luck in the Valley
label: Thrill Jockey
description: One of the de facto leaders of the resurgent movement of John Fahey devotees, Jack Rose recorded this triumph shortly before his recent death.

title: Similes
label: Temporary Residence
description: Accomplished ambient artist expands his sound to include delicate new elements-- soft percussion, his own voice-- creating distant pop songs.

title: The Golden Archipelago
label: Matador
description: Following career-peak Rook, Jonathan Meiburg and co. return with another excellent record of restrained grandiosity and enigmatic grace.

title: European
label: Labrador
description: The Gothenburg, Sweden-based indie pop band demonstrates the virtues of cosmpolitanism, craft, and restraint.

title: Standing on Top of Utopia
label: HFN
description: Scandinavian producer trades in vocal-aided tracks that are odd and disparate and instrumental cuts that are even more schizophrenic.

title: Fabric 50
label: Fabric
description: Fabric's top mix series here finds the dubstep A-lister showcasing his increasingly divergent interests, touching on all manners of UK dance subgenres.

title: The Meat of Life
description: After almost breaking up during the recording of 2009's The Hungry Bird, Clem Snide are back, if not exactly re-energized.

title: Have One on Me
label: Drag City
description: The full-length follow-up to Ys is no less ambitious, but this 3xLP set also has some of the most inviting and accessible songs of Newsom's career.

title: Animalore
label: Undertow
description: Brooklyn band retains its debut's mature, earnestly proficient folk-pop and adds touches of funk, R&B, and humor.

title: The Years EP
label: Arcade Sound
description: Chillwave newcomers take a more relatively somber approach to bedroom-produced nostalgia, lending this EP a more classic, polished feel.

title: Tidings
label: Jagjaguwar
description: London band mixes blues-rock with English folk and bits of glam rock, stitching together the songs with abstract interludes.

title: American Gong
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: Portland indie supergroup focuses on its strengths and boils its songs to their most essential ingredients on their best album in years.

title: Hidden
label: Domino
description: UK post-punk revivalists tear up their own rulebook and start from scratch on this ambitious, darkly experimental second album.

title: Sigh No More
label: Glassnote
description: West London band's faux family business actually sounds like a business, one supplying value-added products at discount prices.

title: We Are Proud of Our Choices
label: Kompakt
description: Producer and remixer extraordinaire straddles the pop and the underground on this rhythmically diverse Kompakt mix.

title: Prenuptial Agreement
label: SMC
description: Rising Oakland rapper has a genuine ability to entertain without trivializing the significance of the tragic underpinnings that give his songs their power.

title: Presidence
label: Paw Tracks
description: Brooklyn avant-rock collective helms a 130-minute 2xCD set: Put simply, Disc One is mostly classic Excepter, and Disc Two is mostly something else.

title: Black Noise
label: Rough Trade
description: German producer builds minimal techno epic from a beautifully textured sound palette. Panda Bear guests.

title: Planets of Old
label: Hydra Head
description: Hipster metal O.G.s bring their 2009 comeback EP to CD, recalling both their slicker crossover sound and chop-heavy prog roots.

title: Fixin' the Charts, Vol. 1
artist: Everybody Was in the French Resistance...Now!
label: Cooking Vinyl
description: Art Brut's Eddie Argos teams with Dyan Valdés on an LP of "answer songs"; what makes for a mildly amusing MySpace click can lead to a painfully obnoxious album.

title: Tapestry of Webs
label: Suicide Squeeze
description: Former members of Blood Brothers make a clean break from the past by offering an LP marked by quiet tension and gradual builds.

title: We All Got Out of the Army
label: Guided By Voices, Inc.
description: Pollard's first solo album of 2010 is a hefty glam-pop record with a brighter, more nuanced sound reminiscent of GBV's Isolation Drills.

title: The Stimulus Package
label: Rhymesayers
description: The former Roc-A-Fella star brings his ferocious voice and unique intensity to Rhymesayers, here teaming on a record with Jake One.

title: Maudlin
label: Team Love
description: Team Love band embraces arrested development with a drink in one hand and Dylan's lyrics sheet in the other.

title: Peace & Love
label: Ye Olde
description: Ten albums into her solo career, the alt-rock veteran goes it alone, playing every instrument in a mostly-acoustic setting.

title: The Minimal Wave Tapes: Vol. 1
label: Stones Throw
description: Stones Throw offers an expertly crafted introduction to a label focused on unearthing electronic DIY music from the late 1970s and 80s.

title: Measure
label: Memphis Industries
description: After breaking to work as School of Language and the Week That Was, the brothers Brewis return for a new Field Music LP.

title: Causers of This
label: Carpark
description: More of a producer than a composer, Toro Y Moi carries the chillwave torch into 2010 and works best when he's exploring sounds instead of songs.

title: Found Songs
label: Erased Tapes
description: The young Icelandic composer who has opened for Sigur Rós constructs an album of short but emotionally-charged pieces for strings and piano.

title: XXXX
label: Paper Bag
description: Canadian dance-punk survivors' new album looks like a winking porn reference but it's a moody, melancholy look at another four-letter word.

title: Dream Get Together
label: Dead Oceans
description: Ezra Feinberg again gathers the totems and taboos of 1970s rock, exploring the excitable intersection of psychedelia and pop.

title: Kollaps Tradixionales
artist: Thee Silver Mt. Zion Memorial Orchestra
label: Constellation
description: Constellation's flagship band continues to evolve from a meditative orchestro-folk ensemble into a politically enraged rock band.

title: Scratch My Back
label: Virgin
description: The dignified prog and pop star returns from another long layoff with a covers LP featuring takes on Arcade Fire, Bon Iver, Radiohead, and Magnetic Fields.

title: Mountain Debris
label: No Pain in Pop
description: Mixing 90s alt rock and of-the-moment lo-fi haze and hypnagogic pop pastiche, this UK auteur is crafting a very now sound.

title: Face a Frowning World: An E.C. Ball Memorial Album
label: Tompkins Square
description: Bonnie "Prince" Billy, the Handsome Family, and others cover this itinerant folk-gospel artist, who preached salvation more than damnation.

title: Frauhaus
label: Angular
description: All-female British trio's sophomore effort celebrates their percussive, atonal foremothers like the Slits, the Raincoats, and LiLiPUT.

title: Falling Down a Mountain
label: 4AD
description: The veteran UK band continues to re-locate itself on this, its second album since the departure of three of its original six members.

title: Gorilla Manor
label: Frenchkiss
description: Local Natives have a familiar sound-- rustic vocals, harmonies, clattering percussion-- but songwriting skill and youthful energy mark their striking debut.

title: Playtime
label: Workshop
description: Collaboration between house producer Move D and Spacetime Continuum's Jonah Sharp is a no-seams mix of gliding house music and ambient composition.

title: The Amazing
label: Subliminal Sounds
description: Sharing members with Dungen, this Swedish group alternates between moody acoustic folk rumination and various permutations of stoner-friendly rock.

title: North/South/East/West
label: Bleep
description: Warp gathers top artists from four locales-- NYC, L.A., London, and Glasgow-- to create an all-star wonky album featuring FlyLo, Skream, FaltyDL, and more.

title: Renihilation
label: 20 Buck Spin
description: These "Brooklyn hipsters" treat extreme metal with the élan of a ripe young garage rock band or a focused noise artist.

title: Soldier of Love
label: Sony
description: The classic soft-rock band returns with its first album in a decade, and it still seems wholly unique and oddly captivating.

title: Casual Victim Pile
label: Matador
description: Matador boss Gerard Cosloy curates a compilation highlighting his favorite Austin-area bands of the past few years.

title: Frictionalism 1994-2009
label: Rush Hour
description: This 3xCD, 35-track retrospective places many tracks on CD for the first time and sheds light on one of Detroit techno's great, unclaimed dance artists.

title: The Calcination of Scout Niblett
label: Drag City
description: Niblett's music has always been lonely, introverted, and anguished, but the stakes seem much higher on this album, like it's a do-or-die scenario.

title: Periphery
label: Graveface
description: On her debut LP, Black Moth Super Rainbow member Maux Boyle crafts ambient music using synthesizers and lightly treated piano.

title: Odd Blood
label: Secretly Canadian
description: A tighter, slicker, poppier sophomore album tries on every imaginable sound and style-- but none is as original or effective as the one they started with.

title: Interference
label: Social Registry
description: This lost act recorded unreleased music for Glenn Branca's label that split the difference between Swans and ESG. Now Social Registry releases their stuff.

title: Aufgang
label: Discograph
description: Blending classical piano, live drums, and techno-inspired electronics, Aufgang's fresh sound is hard to classify.

title: It Was Easy
label: Ernest Jenning
description: Q and Not U drummer John Davis, formerly of Georgie James, continues the latter band's power-pop lean with his new project.

title: Thin Thin Line
label: Caldo Verde
description: The singer-songwriter with a devoted cult following returns with a fine album on Mark Kozelek's Caldo Verde imprint.

title: I'm New Here
label: XL
description: The influential singer-songwriter returns after many years with a powerful album that mixes spoken word, folk, and blues over roughed-up sonics.

title: Si, Para Usted: The Funky Beats of Revolutionary Cuba, Vol. 2
label: Waxing Deep
description: This retrospective gathers songs from Cuba's 1960s and 70s, a time when global pop was blending with the country's traditional music.

title: Raiders
label: Not Not Fun
description: Either a doom band with drone overtones or a drone one with doom overtones, L.A. duo Robedoor follow in the footsteps of Double Leopards, Axolotl, and others.

title: AFCGT
label: Sub Pop
description: Former members of the still-underrated A-Frames team with members of Climax Golden Twins for a record of drones and sound collages.

title: Songs About People I Know
label: Kora
description: Delightfully ramshackle, this UK indie pop band works wonderfully in spite of seemingly being another jumble of influences.

title: Heligoland
label: Virgin
description: On their first non-soundtrack album in seven years, original member Daddy G returns and Damon Albarn, Hope Sandoval, and Elbow's Guy Garvey guest.

title: Talking to You, Talking to Me
label: Vanguard
description: The angelic-voiced L.A. folk-rock revivalists add versatility and personality to their sound.

title: Heart of My Own
label: Rough Trade
description: A rare find in the crowded folk-pop world, this Rough Trade singer/songwriter is engagingly versatile and fresh.

title: Daptone Gold
label: Daptone
description: Studiosly re-creating the sounds of 1960s and 70s soul, Daptone has gained a deserved cult following; here it collects some of its best recordings.

title: Ali and Toumani
label: World Circuit
description: The uncommonly beautiful final recordings by Malian guitar pioneer Ali Farka Touré find him once again joined by Toumani Diabaté.

title: One Life Stand
label: Astralwerks
description: Dialing back some of their eccentricities and embracing personal songwriting, Hot Chip have crafted their most consistent album yet.

title: 144 Pulsations of Light
label: Kranky
description: Kranky debut from a California artist who sits nicely alongside the meditative sounds of Gas, Boards of Canada, and Stars of the Lid.

title: Good God! Born Again Funk
label: Numero Group
description: Second in Numero's gospel series is easily as good as the first and funky enough to grab any listener with a taste for rhythm, religious or not.

title: In Search of Stoney Jackson
label: Stones Throw
description: Stones Throw continues to widen its circle of L.A. connections, pairing Madlib's production work with this post-Death Row SoCal crew.

title: The Soft Pack
label: Kemado
description: Formerly known as the Muslims, much buzzed-about California band evolves, grafting some finesse and introspection onto their garage-rock template.

title: Dreamland EP: Marimba and Shit-Drums
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Spencer Krug takes a detour under a new alias, constructing a suprisingly affecting and dreamlike 20-minute track using the instruments in the EP's subtitle.

title: Shape of the Shape
label: Locust
description: Manchester band unexpectedly moves from Pentangle-like folk-rock to a weird and intriguing combination of cosmic country and space-age Moog drones.

title: Sadly, the Future Is No Longer What It Once Was
label: History Always Favours the Winners
description: Leyland Kirby, aka V/VM, creates a 3xCD set of anodyne melodies focused on mood, composition, and performance.

title: A Chorus of Storytellers
label: Sub Pop
description: Post-rock veterans and Sigur Rós associates continue to create twinkling, mostly instrumental music with IDM textures.

title: Mind Chaos
label: Virgin
description: Portland buzz band sounds like NYC 00s buzz bands-- specifically, like the precise midpoint between the Strokes and LCD Soundsystem.

title: Rebirth
label: Cash Money
description: He really went ahead and did it: Lil Wayne finally releases his unlikely, unqualified, and quite unbelievable rock album.

title: Leaving on a Mayday
label: Verve Forecast
description: Swedish star takes another stab at the U.S. market with her third LP. Björn Yttling produces; Sonic Youth's Steve Shelley and Chavez's Matt Sweeney guest.

title: You & Me
label: Gnomonsong
description: Freak folk linchpin, who counts Currituck County and Vetiver among his projects, releases his first LP under his own name. Joanna Newsom guests.

title: Tumbélé! Biguine, Afro and Latin Sounds From The French Caribbean, 1963-1974
label: Soundway
description: The Soundway label offers a primer on the musical crosscurrents found in Martinique and Guadeloupe.

title: Ugly Side of Love
label: Domino
description: The Bristol duo championed by Portishead's Geoff Barrow indulge in sample-heavy pop that seems pulled from a UK pirate-radio broadcast from 1973.

title: The Courage of Others
label: Bella Union
description: The recent breakout band follows its delightful 2006 album, The Trials of Van Occupanther, with a long-awaited new folk-pop record.

title: Ommatidia
label: Intransitive
description: Boston improv duo deals primarily in slow, sparse sounds-- a form of improvisation known as reductionism-- but the effect is far from minimal.

title: Rifts
label: No Fun
description: One of a handful of new artists making exquisitely crafted, ear-opening forays into drone collects his limited-run output onto a 2xCD set.

title: Paper Dolls
label: Lil' Chief
description: New Zealand-based indie pop duo continues to strike an odd balance of child-like singsong simplicity and subtle sophistication.

title: The House of Love / The German Album
label: Arena Rock
description: One of modern rock's great should-have-been bands has its two Creation Records LPs reissued in the U.S.

title: Couple Tracks
label: Matador
description: The Toronto hardcore band issues its second singles compilation, which begins with its debut single and leapfrogs around the group's fruitful career.

title: Accelerated Living
label: Kemado
description: Oakland band dials down the sludgy thwomp of its previous work in favor of run'n'gun thrash metal.

title: Einzelkämpfer
label: AGF Producktion
description: Experimental German producer Antye Greie, who has worked with the likes of Ellen Allien and Vladislav Delay, returns with her sixth solo album.

title: Journal of Ardency
label: Terrible
description: Former solo folkie Elizabeth Harper's new dance-pop project features the frosty sonics and compelling vocals that made her 80s influences so memorable.

title: Life Is Sweet! Nice to Meet You
label: Domino
description: Former Test Icicles member recruits Animal Collective producer for an album that plays like a product of his musical restlessness.

title: Romance Is Boring
label: Arts & Crafts
description: The divisive and highly personal Welsh group continues to grow up, embrace its inner punk, churn out amazing lyrics, and sharpen its edge.

title: Adventures in Experimental Electric Orchestra from the San Francisco Psychedelic Underground
label: Mexican Summer
description: Former Manson associate, still imprisoned, has a 2xLP set of "electric symphony orchestra" music issued by Mexican Summer.

title: No Hope, No Future
label: Brille
description: London's Good Shoes lie somewhere between a less insular Arctic Monkeys and a less caffeinated Futureheads, and here they return with album number two.

title: Night Music
label: Domino
description: With help from Detroit techno godfather Carl Craig, former Zombie Zombie member creates a haunted, sinister take on electronic music.

title: To Realize
label: Lovepump United
description: Oakland three-piece continues to create outstanding Liars-like rock that places its faith in texture, atmospherics, and shades of light and dark.

title: Stroke: Songs for Chris Knox
label: Merge
description: An all-star lineup-- Mangum, Oldham, YLT, Callahan, Merritt, Darnielle, Jay Reatard-- pays tribute to the iconic Kiwi singer/songwriter and stroke sufferer.

title: Forge Your Own Chains: Heavy Psychedelic Ballads and Dirges 1968-1974
label: Now Again
description: Collecting strains of heavy psych from five continents, this ambitious, thoughtful release is also unsurprisingly erratic.

title: Versions
label: Aagoo
description: The slippery, underappreciated Portland band reworks its own previous material, and in just about every case improve upon the source material.

label: Sub Pop
description: The second full-length from the rocking side project of Low's Alan Sparhawk builds nicely on the sound of their debut LP.

title: Turn Ons
label: Fat Possum
description: Following a split with their label, two-thirds of Supergrass team with producer Nigel Godrich and create a stopgap all-covers project.

title: IRM
label: Because
description: After a 2006 album created in collaboration with Air and Jarvis Cocker, Charlotte Gainsbourg returns with a surprisingly great LP written and produced by Beck.

title: YellowFever
label: Wild World
description: Playing girl-group pop drenched in noise, like their pals Vivian Girls, YellowFever offer more surprises and Easter eggs on this hyper-aware record.

title: Together You and I
label: Skybucket
description: The folk troubadour's fourth album bends musical elements to reinforce his lyrics, which show a strong grasp of character and voice.

title: Pop Ambient 2010
label: Kompakt
description: A pair of Brock Van Wey tracks, plus new ones from DJ Koze and Dettinger highlight the latest version of Kompakt's annual ambient series.

title: FabricLive 49
label: Fabric
description: A hugely diverse and dense mix from the Portuguese outfit includes selections from Zomby, Major Lazer, Crime Mob, and many more.

title: Realism
label: Nonesuch
description: Stephin Merritt explores another aesthetic conceit on his latest record, creating a characteristically self-aware play at a "folk" record.

title: One-Armed Bandit
label: Ninja Tune
description: The ambitious Norwegian band with a hard-to-define jazz/ post-rock sound returns with another eclectic album.

title: The Biggest Ragga Dancehall Anthems 2009 / The Biggest Reggae One-Drop Anthems 2009
label: Greensleeves
description: Greensleeves Records issues its two high-profile, annual looks at the past 12 months' worth of the most fruitful types of Jamaican pop.

title: Setting the Paces
label: Magic Marker
description: Pacific Northwest songwriter David Crane beefs up a batch of songs about childhood and innocence with meatier rock production on BOAT's latest.

title: Acolyte
label: Polydor
description: The latest attempt to rescue the UK from landfill indie, Delphic are a hotly tipped band that is being branded as a new New Order.

title: Teen Dream
label: Sub Pop
description: Teen Dream is both the most diverse and most listenable of the Baltimore band's three full-lengths, and yet it never seems like a compromise.

title: Five American Portraits
label: Drag City
description: With help from Jim O'Rourke and the Raincoats' Gina Birch, Red Krayola and A&L combine classic tunes with portraits of famous figures.

title: Book of Leaves
label: RuminanCe
description: Best known for her stint in chamber ensemble Rachel's, the Louisville pianist's solo debut is in the same neo-classical vein as her old group.

title: The Flexible Entertainer
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Having previously fed on a diet of everything post-punk, the now-duo is opening up to rhythms and sounds from modern R&B.

title: Sturm
label: Alien Transistor
description: Beloved German band releases a soundtrack record so generic that selling it as a Notwist record feels faintly deceitful.

title: There Is Love in You
label: Domino
description: Driven by dance-inspired beats and ghostly sampled voices, the new Four Tet album is the most focused in Kieran Hebden's catalog, and also among his best.

title: Silence
label: Imbalance Computer Music
description: Blending techno, dubstep, and ambient into an hour of idiosyncratic drift, this is programmed electronic music at its most sensually expressive.

title: Francophonic, Vol. 2: 1980-1989
artist: Franco & le Tout Puissant OK Jazz
label: Sterns Africa
description: The second volume of the Stearns label's anthology of the Congolese bandleader's recordings is thunderbolts and fireworks, start to finish.

title: Black Wooden EP
label: Southern
description: Phil Elverum contributes to a series that asks musicians to create "something spontaneous, collaborative, fun, or experimental."

title: Zephyr EP
label: XL
description: The house music legends go on an unexpected detour here, offering an EP of synth washes, ethnographic pastiches, and soft-rock jams.

title: Diplo Presents: Free Gucci (Best of The Cold War Mixtapes)
label: Mad Decent
description: Quintessential Atlanta MC Gucci Mane is given an indie reinvention via Diplo and a host of top producers-- Zomby, FlyLo, Memory Tapes.

title: Dimensional Bleedthrough
label: Profound Lore
description: Metal supergroup, led by Mick Barr, creates something for fans of black metal, noise, and drone to all love.

title: What Day Is it Tonight?
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Trans Am explore a career's worth of 1970s rock cliché and 80s synth-rock cliché on this strong live album and DVD.

title: Up From Below
label: Rough Trade
description: Dude from Ima Robot reemerges as a folk-pop singer, winning over satellite radio and late-night TV producers for some reason.

title: End Times
label: V2
description: Mark Oliver Everett returns with another record of sadsack self-pity, without even the tinges of humor that typically color his work.

title: Astro Coast
label: Kanine
description: The debut LP from this young Florida band is first and foremost a great guitar album packed with sing-along hooks, but there's more going on beneath the surface.

title: You Are the One I Pick
label: Kranky
description: Kranky issues the debut album by this UK chamber-pop duo, who counts Erik Satie, PJ Harvey, and Rachel's among their influences.

title: Trust
label: Kompakt
description: Kompakt producer continues to re-imagine trance as a worthy component of chic modern techno.

title: Make It Sound in Tune
label: Merge
description: Merge leader Mac McCaughan gives his label's acts-- including Spoon, the Magnetic Fields, and Lambchop-- the covers treatment on this charity EP.

title: Intimate Moments for a Sensual Evening
label: Comedy Central
description: Indie comic follows his "Parks and Rec" stardom with a collection of his best stand-up bits, including nine minutes of RAAAAAAAANDY.

title: Real Life Is No Cool
label: Smalltown Supersound
description: After elongating his brand of retro-futurism to great song lengths, the Norweigan producer crafts an achingly stylish and neatly accessible dance record.

title: Carousel
label: Darla
description: The latest instrumental album from the mastermind of the Cocteau Twins' sound delivers the magisterial guitar tones one has come to expect from his projects.

title: Underwater Peoples Winter Review
label: Underwater Peoples
description: The upstart Underwater Peoples-- the label that birthed Real Estate-- follows its summer 2009 comp with another seasonal collection.

title: Athens
label: !K7
description: The famed progressive house band collect a few of their favorite things.

title: Roy Montgomery/Grouper
label: Root Strata
description: Grouper follows her outstanding 2008 LP with another mix of submerged instruments and field recordings, on a split with a new Roy Montgomery track.

title: Transference
label: Merge
description: Trading some of their signature groove for a more destabilizing sound, Spoon have created an offbeat, unexpected, but ultimately cerebral record.

title: Climb Up
label: ATP
description: New England post-rock group trades their debut's gloomy swirl for a more linear, prog-leaning take on chugging radio rock.

title: July Flame
label: Bella Union
description: Neo-folkie takes the best aspects of her two previous records and distills them into her best album. MMJ's Jim James and the Decemberists' Chris Funk guest.

title: Rain on the City
label: Bar/None
description: The dependable singer-songwriter who debuted in the alt-rock era returns with his first album of new songs in eight years.

title: The Colossus
label: RJ's Electrical Connections
description: After a foray into singer-songwriter territory, Rjd2 rediscovers mood-setting backgrounds and rattling, rigged-to-explode instrumentals.

title: The Dark Side of the Moon
label: Warner Bros.
description: Originally conceived for a New Year's Eve show, the Flaming Lips and guests Peaches and Henry Rollins cover the Pink Floyd classic.

title: Hustler's Son
label: Team Love
description: Rilo Kiley drummer follows the lead of his bandmates by making a solo record that leans heavily toward the rootsy-- sounding most like 1990s alt-country.

title: All Shall Fall
label: Nuclear Blast
description: The 1990s Norwegian black metal band is still sharpening its singular sound.

title: Legendary Hearts / New Sensations
label: Iconoclassic
description: The two very different paths that Lou Reed traversed after his 1982 comeback The Blue Mask are reissued and remastered.

title: The Little Match Girl Passion
label: Harmonia Mundi
description: Adapting a Hans Christian Andersen fable, the Bang on a Can co-founder has produced the most profound and emotionally resonant work of his career.

title: Heartland
label: Domino
description: After several releases as Final Fantasy, Owen Pallett makes his debut under his own name, and it's his grandest and most assured statement to date.

title: Eddy Current Suppression Ring / Primary Colours
label: Goner
description: Australia's promising young garage rock band finally has its two best bits of minimalist guitar music issued in the States.

title: Fabric 48
label: Fabric
description: Radio Slave's blend of lush, hypnotic minimal-into-house is almost like a tribute to the sound of 2007, in the best sense.

title: Is There Nothing We Could Do?
label: AWAL
description: The former Next Big Thing dusts off some of his long-dormant qualities for this appealing soundtrack record.

title: Funtown Comedown
artist: Bonny Billy and the Picket Line
label: Drag City
description: Will Oldham's latest is a fittingly titled, string-band live LP released digitally and on vinyl with little fanfare during the final bleak days of 2009.

title: Campfire Songs
label: Paw Tracks
description: Animal Collective's transitional 2003 album, recorded in one long take on a porch in the Maryland woods, is reissued on their Paw Tracks imprint.

title: Low Tide Digitals III
label: Rune Grammofon
description: Out-music veterans continue their decade-long collaboration with an album of severe modern classical, harsh noise, and ambient music.

title: A Parallax I
label: Polyvinyl
description: Of Montreal member and frequent E6 collaborator releases a solo debut full of fragments of his day band's genetic material.

title: Judy Sucks a Lemon for Breakfast
label: Ample Play
description: More than a decade after their peak, the UK band returns with their unique palette of perspective, imagination, and humor still in place.

title: Reality EP
label: Mexican Summer
description: Real Estate cap their fruitful first year with a collection of new songs-- many of which are the solo work of chief songwriter Martin Courtney.

title: The Fame Monster
label: Interscope
description: Lady Gaga's second record, containing "Bad Romance" and "Speechless", finds her coming into her own as both a songwriter and a pop star.

title: Eggs
label: Friendly Fire
description: This Copenhagen band seems to specialize in volcanic sound effects, but it manages to write some pretty compelling songs along the way.

title: Gonna Work Out Fine
label: Hemlock
description: Jack Dunning aka Untold's final 2009 Hemlock release cements his status as one of post-dubstep's-- hell, electronic music's-- most vital producers.

title: Huntsville International
label: Unknown
description: Underdog hip-hop group manages to expertly reimagine trance as a soundtrack for a lonely southern stoner rather than as club anthem fodder.

title: Fela: The Best of the Black President
label: Knitting Factory
description: With a full reissue campaign coming-- and a show in his honor on Broadway-- Fela's re-examination year kicks off with this comp.

title: VH1 Storytellers
label: Def Jam
description: This live set finds Kanye inserting rambling monologues in the middle of his songs, not so much storytelling as a bizarre string of WTF asides.

title: Movies Is Magic
label: Anticipate
description: Kompakt vet Sebastian Meissner explores cinematic sweep and the notion of film music as home listening on his new LP.

title: Rejoicer
label: Death By Audio
description: New York's Grooms, formerly known as Muggabears, ably and enjoyably channel the spirit and sound of 1990s alt-rock and indie.

title: The Voidist
label: Tee Pee
description: Yeah Yeah Yeahs sideman finally makes a nimble, grandiose album all his own, one that feels like a move towards his own spotlight.

title: The Burrprint: The Movie 3-D / The State vs. Radric Davis
label: Unknown
description: Underground rap's biggest breakout of 2008-09 finally releases his major-label debut; plus, a look at the best of his many recent mixtapes.

title: Contra
label: XL
description: The divisive Vampire Weekend return with LP number two, and Contra finds them embracing their eccentricities without shame or apology.

title: An Exaltation of Laarks
label: Absolutely Kosher
description: Absolutely Kosher band creates a well-crafted document of the 2000s, a time period we're still in the process of digesting

title: The Mantles
label: Siltbreeze
description: San Franciscan five-piece churns out sharp, garage-minded jangle-pop with more bite than most of their peers.

title: Gone: The Promises Of Yesterday
label: Numero Group
description: Buried somewhere down in the footnotes of the story of Stax Records is 24-Carat Black. Numero Group thankfully unearths them.

title: By the Throat
label: Bedroom Community
description: Australia-born, Iceland-based producer creates one of the most menacing-- and rewarding-- ambient records of the past year.

title: We Are Young Money
label: Cash Money
description: In the spirit of work from Dipset and Bad Boy, Lil Wayne creates a clique record, and-- with Drake and Nicki Minaj on board-- pulls it off.

title: Strange Gods
label: Zum
description: Reminiscent of Fuck Buttons or Black Dice, Philly's David Harms combines heavily repetitive rhythms with noisy, thickly textured loops.

title: Triptych / Vice Versa, etc.
label: Important
description: Important Records reissues two albums from the French drone composer, which were previously unavailable in digital form.

title: Young One
label: Captured Tracks
description: Assembling previously released material, this duo-- he from Blank Dogs, she from the Dum Dum Girls-- revels in the contrasts between their music.

title: ATL RMX
label: Adultswim.com
description: Free mixtape from Adult Swim pairs Atlanta's top rappers (Jeezy, Cee-Lo, Gucci) with some of today's top indie producers (El-P, FlyLo, Dam-Funk).

title: Gazzillion Ear EP
label: Lex
description: The standout track from Born Like This gets the remix EP treatment, with work from Thom Yorke, Dave Sitek, and Jneiro Jarel.

title: Chimeric
label: Thrill Jockey
description: A relatively looser, more open approach suits the Austrian electro-acoustic trio.

title: The Dance Paradox
label: Delsin
description: As Burial reworked the signifiers of UK Garage into an extremely personal sound, Redshape takes the essential tropes of classic techno and does the same.

title: Alphabet 1968
label: Type
description: Black to Comm successfully probes the depths of ambient, drone, and modern classical composition with both restraint and imagination.

title: Who Designs Nature's How
label: Arts & Crafts
description: Arcade Fire members' other band enlists Tim Hecker, Mad Professor, Kid Koala, and more to help craft this remix EP.

title: Enemy of the State: A Love Story
label: self-released
description: Getting back to business, the Chicago MC provides a potent reminder of his sheer technical prowess on this brief yet rewarding mixtape.

title: Of the Body Prone
label: Tzadik
description: Asheville, N.C.-based trio releases its latest record on John Zorn's Tzadik label, a logical fit for their abstract, surprising music.

title: Milky Ways
label: !K7
description: French producer's latest veers from post-rock jamminess to rock pastiche but its best moments come when he settles into contemplative dance mode.

title: God Is a Twelve-Year-Old Boy With Asperger's
label: Sub Pop
description: Indie comedy vet and "Flight of the Conchords" regular issues his latest Sub Pop stand-up album.

title: The Singles, Vol. 8: 1972-1973
label: Hip-O Select
description: The latest set of JB singles finds him making odd decisions in an attempt to be seen as important and socially vital. Most of them work out fine.

title: Prison Break EP
label: Sincerely Yours
description: This digital-only EP features uniformly solid remixes from El Guincho, jj, and others, plus an incredible one from the Juan MacLean.

title: Slow Attack
label: B A Songs
description: The former Suede singer finds unlikely inspiration in Talk Talk and makes his best solo album.

title: Kitsuné Maison 8
label: Kitsuné
description: The Paris-based label again shows its range and strong ear, with a comp featuring Memory Tapes, the Drums, and Chew Lips vs. Alex Kapranos.

title: In This Light and on This Evening
label: Fader
description: Album number three from the popular UK post-punk acolytes finds them moving to a more synth-based sound to dreary effect.

title: My Dusty Road
label: Rounder
description: A treasure for historians and folk fans alike, this 4xCD set collects more than 50 long-lost mid-1940s performances from the American legend.

title: Untitled
label: Jive
description: After surviving for years in a ravenously young genre (and, of course, his legal battles), this beguiling pop culture oddball finds himself oddly adrfit.

title: Fire in My Bones: Raw + Rare + Otherworldly African-American Gospel, 1944-2007
label: Tompkins Square
description: This gospel set covers a wide range of approaches: from contented to contemptuous, sessions to field recordings, fevered shouts to ruminative moans.

title: Xenophanes
label: Rodriguez López
description: The latest in a large run of 2009 solo records from Omar Rodriguez-López may be the tightest Mars Volta-related release in years.

title: Echo Kid
label: Fat Possum
description: Once a Be Your Own Pet side project, Turbo Fruits issue their first LP since the dissolution of their day-job band.

title: Klang
label: V2
description: The UK indie band returns to the spirit and energy of their promising debut, and then unexpectedly breaks up after releasing this record.

title: Neil Young / Everybody Knows This Is Nowhere / After the Gold Rush / Harvest
label: Reprise
description: Neil Young's first four albums, remastered and gathered together in a pricey (but impressive) box set.

title: Darkness Come Alive
label: Deathwish
description: Converge's Nate Newton takes his band's hardcore punk roots and adds Thin Lizzy's guitar harmonies and Motörhead's high-octane grime.

title: Ghost
label: Lefse
description: One of rising label Lefse Records' marquee fall releases, the debut from this San Diego three-piece is more about promise than delivery.

title: Television
label: Palm
description: The Senegalese legend returns with his first album since 2001's Missing You (Mi Yeewnii).

title: Fantastic Mr. Fox OST
label: ABKCO
description: The OST to Wes Anderson's animated tale features the director's faves (the Stones, Beach Boys), plus Jarvis Cocker and composer Alexandre Desplat.

title: Til the Casket Drops
label: Columbia
description: Rap's preeminent group returns with their first LP not entirely produced by the Neptunes, and first LP in years without a protracted label battle.

title: Jarvik Mindstate
label: Punch Drunk
description: One of dubstep's key producers makes his full-length album debut, with few concessions for non-fans for good or bad.

title: Kids Aflame
label: Gigantic
description: Ex-Harlem Shakes guitarist offers his first solo album of mostly unvarying, lo-fi instrumentation, which sounds nothing like Harlem Shakes.

title: Zounds
label: Dangerbird
description: Sydney band with prog leanings and widescreen inclinations blows up its sound even further this time out.

title: White Water, White Bloom
label: Dangerbird
description: Swoony, melodic songs delivered with aching sincerity-- no wonder this fit so well on the Twilight soundtrack.

title: Music For Insomnia
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: Asthmatic Kitty co-founder teams with his partner and stepson, Sufjan Stevens, and the National's Bryce Dessner for a record of avant-garde experimentalism.

title: Light: On the South Side
label: Numero Group
description: Numero Group create their most lavish package yet-- a look at the 1970s Chicago soul scene, complete with a book full of Michael Abramson photography.

title: How to Be a Lady, Volume 1
label: Def Jam
description: With production by The-Dream and his cohorts, this R&B group's debut features lush slow jams and rococo, information-overload uptempo tracks.

label: Rune Grammofon
description: The mysterious and often rapturous Norwegian avant-garde collective releases its first record as a trio.

title: Renaissance: The Mix Collection
label: Renaissance
description: The German duo put together a history-lesson-cum-slow-burn showcase featuring some of 2009's best dance music, and many classics.

title: Elvis 75: Good Rockin' Tonight
label: Legacy
description: To mark Elvis' 75th birthday, Legacy issues a new 4xCD, 100-song box set drawing from the singer's entire career.

title: Endless Bummer
label: Rvng Intl.
description: Philly disco crew mixes limber dance-punk and funk tracks with dreamier, more contemplative fare, resulting in a varied set that works as an album.

title: Dr. No's Ethiopium
label: Stones Throw
description: Madlib's younger brother continues to develop his own recognizably consistent and characteristic style, here working with Ethiopian music of the 1960s and 70s.

title: New York-Addis-London: The Story of Ethio Jazz 1965-1975
label: Strut
description: This collection of tracks from the Ethiopian bandleader shows the power of his unique fusion.

title: Asleep in the Back [Deluxe Edition]
label: Polydor
description: Stately, luxurious sounding, professional-- one of the decade's quietly underrated bands has its best album given a 2xCD/DVD reissue.

title: Lifter Puller / Half Dead and Dynamite / The Entertainment and Arts EP / Fiestas and Fiascos / Slips Backwards
label: Orchard
description: The Hold Steady's Craig Finn has the bulk of his cult classic group's catalog digitally reissued.

title: Pyramids With Nadja
label: Hydra Head
description: Toronto metalgaze duo Nadja pairs with the Denton, Texas, outfit Pyramids for an expansive, effects-heavy album of surprising focus.

title: Armonico Hewa
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Japanese all-female group and Boredoms offshoot continues to refine its unique, experimental voice.

title: Tribute to the Sun
label: Cadenza
description: His second full-length marks Luciano as a techno producer whose sound-world is uncommonly vast and even more uncommonly fertile.

title: Score! The Remixes!
label: Merge
description: Merge caps its 20th anniversary year with a charity record that finds Four Tet, Caribou, Junior Boys, and more reworking songs from the label's catalog.

title: Dreamin' Man
label: Reprise
description: The latest entry in Young's fabled Archives series is a peculiar one: live versions of the songs that eventually were released as Harvest Moon.

title: Cocoon of Love
label: Kanine
description: This baroque-pop band comes off as the Left Coast answer to the Vampire Weekend/Grizzly Bear boat-shoe/literary reference set.

label: Kompakt
description: The longtime Icelandic collective hooks up with the venerable techno label Kompakt on its latest record.

title: Florine
label: Florid
description: Rising talent Julianna Barwick has her ethereal, gorgeous EP given a well-deserved wide release.

title: Good Evening New York City
label: Hear Music
description: CD/DVD package attempts the difficult job of capturing a stadium-sized show from the Beatles legend.

title: Felt 3: A Tribute to Rosie Perez
label: Rhymesayers
description: The cream of U.S. indie hip-hop-- Murs and Atmosphere's Slug MCing, with production from Aesop Rock-- combine for the first Felt record in four years.

title: The Treatment
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Indiana shoegaze/slowcore revivalists make a surprisingly crisp, economical record.

title: Dead Zone Boys
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: Formerly Grampall Jookabox, David "Moose" Adamson here crafts an intriguing record about inconspicuousness and civic inattention.

title: The Seventh Seal
label: SMC
description: After 10 years and an aborted Dr. Dre collaboration, the legendary MC releases his comeback album.

title: Toeachizown
label: Stones Throw
description: This 2xCD collection pares down the L.A. producer's 5xCD debut album series, intended as a mission statement for what he calls "modern funk."

title: Rated R
label: Def Jam
description: The R&B star has described the Rated R sessions as "theraputic," and the vitriolic, rough, raw end product is about as brutal as you'd expect.

title: New Worlds
label: Minty Fresh
description: Still best known for playing in other people's bands-- Ash, Client, Bat for Lashes-- Charlotte Hatherley's third solo LP is her most self-assured to date.

title: Echo Party
label: Traffic Entertainment
description: Much-missed underground hip-hop producer returns with an offbeat old-school mix taken from the archives of Traffic Entertainment Group.

title: A Retrospective 1998-2008 or I Was a Christian Emo Twentysomething
label: Film Guerrero
description: Menomena's Danny Seim picks through the best tracks from his Lackthereof project, choosing from the self-released albums that preceded Your Anchor.

title: Blakroc
label: BlakRoc
description: The Black Keys combine with many of hip-hop's top stars-- Mos Def, Q-Tip, RZA, Raekwon-- on a surprisingly well thought-out record.

title: The Catalogue
label: Astralwerks
description: Long-awaited box from one of the most important bands of the last 35 years presents their output from Autobahn forward in remastered and repackaged form.

title: Maybes EP / Sketch on Glass EP
label: Hotflush
description: One of the most promising dubstep producers is also one of those responsible for taking the dance genre places it usually doesn't go: R&B, post-rock, IDM.

title: What We All Come to Need
label: Southern Lord
description: No longer grappling with its identity, this instrumental band now writes efficient, five- to seven-minute songs that, with a few edits, could end up on radio.

title: Buzzrock Warrior
label: Gold Dust Media
description: Co-produced by DJ /rupture and Shadetek with a roster of collaborators, this Guyana-born Brooklyn MC's debut offers a decent set of global grooves.

title: Stir the Blood
label: Island
description: After a misstep of a second album, these modern rock survivors return to the synth-pop that got them on the NME's good side earlier this decade.

title: One Fast Move or I'm Gone: Music From Kerouac's Big Sur
label: Atlantic
description: The Death Cab for Cutie and Son Volt leaders construct songs from Jack Kerouac's prose, all for a doc on the famed writer.

title: Spells
label: self-released
description: Promising L.A. band-- led by the particularly intriguing singer and guitarist Sarah Negahdari-- is another worthy entry in the 90s alt-rock revival.

title: Family
label: Alien8
description: We've spent a lot of the decade with a choice of spazzy, lo-fi electro-funk bands from Montreal, but here's one more worth tracking.

title: Arrow
label: Frog Stand
description: On their sophomore album, New York-based indie poppers seem willing to turn an appreciation of the Fab Four into a guiding artistic principle.

title: New York
label: Rhino
description: Compiling six previously unreleased New York shows from 1955 through to 1990, this large box is a sequel to Sinatra's similarly themed Vegas set.

title: Fall Be Kind EP
label: Domino
description: Ten months after the release of Merriweather Post Pavilion, Animal Collective return with an EP that finds them still on a creative roll.

title: Seconds
label: Drag City
description: The cult songwriter behind the beloved, once-lost folk-rock classic Red Hash makes an inevitable return to writing new songs.

title: Distillation
artist: D. Charles Speer and the Helix
label: Three Lobed
description: No-Neck Blues Band's Dave Shuford continues to find success with his roots-rock offshoot, which trades in twangy guitars and tear-in-beer ballads.

title: Escape 2 Mars
label: Cornerstone
description: The Blackalicious MC makes a comeback on this solo album, which recalls... Blackalicious.

title: Oh, Glory. Oh, Wilderness.
label: Bakery Outlet
description: Four years after their last full-length, Holopaw seem reinvented, sporting a looser, more melodic sound that moves easily between styles.

title: For Your Own Special Sweetheart
label: Dischord
description: The D.C. band's 1994 major label debut, long out of print, has been reissued by Dischord and DeSoto, and it has aged exceedingly well.

title: Trust in Numbers
label: Service
description: Latest find from Service, the Swedish indie pop label that helped launch the Tough Alliance and Jens Lekman. Studio's Dan Lissvik produces.

title: Ouled Bambara: Portraits of Gnawa
label: Drag City
description: This CD/DVD package documents the suite of songs played in Moroccan Gnawa ceremony; it's music that's more spiritual currency than a product or showcase.

title: Idol Omen
label: Western Vinyl
description: Brooklyn duo gets assists from Luke Temple (Here We Go Magic) and Joan as Police Woman on its eerie, elusive, late D Plan-like new album.

title: Can You Dig It? The Music and Politics of Black Action Films 1968-75
label: Soul Jazz
description: The Soul Jazz label offers an excellent 2xCD compilation of early-70s soul and funk from films.

title: Glitter and Doom Live
label: Anti-
description: This live record is a de facto greatest hits of Tom Waits' fourth decade of music, during which his gnarly adventurousness only intensified.

title: Carpet Madness
label: Fat Cat
description: Gallic/English duo mines the coquettish 1960s pop vibe of yé-yé, the precision and throb of UK post-punk, and the syncopation of reggae and tropicalia.

title: Hot Wax
label: Con D'or
description: A decade after his sadly overlooked Good News for Modern Man, the former Hüsker Dü member finally issues his third solo record.

title: Up to Now
label: Interscope
description: The Coldplay acolytes release a deeply overstuffed 2xCD best-of when a crisp singles collection could have done.

title: Live in New York
label: Rhino
description: The much-maligned band makes a case for itself on this sprawling 6xCD collection, recorded just before the release of Morrison Hotel.

label: RJ's Electrical Connections
description: This lavish vinyl-only boxset includes full albums like Deadringer and Since We Last Spoke along with some impressive unreleased material.

title: Blackout Summer
label: In the Red
description: Part of the burgeoning San Diego lo-fi scene that's home to Crocodiles and the Soft Pack, Christmas Island make shaggy, sadsack hymns to heartbreak.

title: Local Currency: Solo 1992-1998
label: Fayettenam
description: Cult guitar pop veteran releases the sort of warts-and-all release that most songwriters would love to call their own.

title: Street Anthems
label: Roll Deep
description: The grime crew that featured Dizzee Rascal, Wiley, and Flowdan gets a welcome retrospective that gathers their raw early work alongside stabs at pop.

title: Do What You Want, Be What You Are: The Music of Daryl Hall and John Oates
label: Legacy
description: This too expansive look at the lengthy career of Hall and Oates features two great discs and two not so hot ones.

title: Them Crooked Vultures
label: Interscope
description: Led Zeppelin's John Paul Jones, Nirvana/Foo Fighters drummer Dave Grohl, and Queens of the Stone Age's Josh Homme resurrect the hard rock supergroup.

title: Historicity
label: ACT Music + Vision
description: The jazz trio continues its outstanding work, reflecting in their music our age of information and chatter. And they do a mean cover of "Galang".

title: Yankee Reality
label: Ecstatic Peace
description: Freak-folk vets make a leap from last year's self-titled Ecstatic Peace! debut that feels markedly deliberate and completely natural. J Mascis produces.

title: Ask the Night
label: Saddle Creek
description: Azure Ray singer trades the full-band sound of her solo debut for a more rustic approach. Modest Mouse's Isaac Brock guests.

title: The Apple and the Tooth
label: Warp
description: The Warp producer collects remixes from his breakthrough album, Ambivalence Avenue, and adds four new tracks on this 2009 punctuation mark.

title: Don't Stop / All Night EP
label: Smalltown Supersound
description: After a long wait and a battle with her former record label, electro-pop should-be star finally issues her second album, plus a bonus EP of older ideas.

title: Continent
label: Paper Bag
description: This young Montreal producer, best known at this point for his remixes and a collaboration with Sally Shapiro, offers an accomplished debut full-length.

title: Sugarland
label: Rare Book Room
description: No Wave-inspired band makes its Rare Book Room debut, bringing an increase in clarity and detail to its thick noise.

title: Ultraviolet
label: Downtown
description: After three years of work, the once-anticipated Kid Sister album finally sees its release.

title: Space Oddity [40th Anniversary Edition]
label: EMI
description: Celebrating the true first chapter in an often brilliant career, David Bowie's second studio album is reissued, complete with a 15-track bonus disc.

title: Real Estate
label: Woodsist
description: After several excellent singles, New Jersey's Real Estate deliver on their full-length debut with a rich collection of evocative and haunting songs.

title: Machine Dreams
label: Peacefrog
description: Swedish quartet make dance-oriented electronic-leaning pop that foregrounds ambiance and texture, as Tricky once did so well.

title: Ignore the Ignorant
label: Warner Bros.
description: Smiths guitar hero Johnny Marr joins one of the brightest lights of post-Libertines UK rock for their fourth album.

title: Before I Self Destruct
label: Interscope
description: After two huge misses and a bleeding of good will, 50 steps back and makes a record designed to appeal to listeners who still might be rooting for the guy.

title: Suitcase 3: Up We Go Now
label: Guided By Voices, Inc.
description: The third 100-song vault-clearing contains unheard demos from Guided by Voices' classic mid-90s era.

title: No Ceilings
label: Young Money Entertainment
description: Weezy returns to mixtape form, where he shows off his digressive, distracted spirit-- still a huge part of what makes him great.

title: Waiting For You
label: Hyperdub
description: With stripped-down, ambient eeriness, the debut LP from this dubstep/dancehall crossover is like a mirror image of the Bug's London Zoo.

title: Rock is Dodelijk
label: Fat Cat
description: Brighton rockers offer a breathless, ripchord performance on this new live disc.

title: Flashmob
label: PIAS
description: The influential dance artist unveils his second act-- and first after blog house producers turned overblown feedback and digital grime into exhausting shtick.

title: Get Yer Ya-Ya's Out! The Rolling Stones in Concert [40th Anniversary Deluxe Box Set]
label: ABKCO
description: The Rolling Stones' go-to-by-default big live album gets a remastering job, but also an odd multi-disc treatment.

title: iTunes Originals
label: DGC
description: This iTunes collection spans YYYs' whole career, and it shows a band willing to adapt and change without regrets or nostalgia for its past.

title: Dog Poison
label: Captured Tracks
description: The hyper-prolific garage-rockers manage to put a few new spins on their familiar formula.

title: Belly of the Lion
label: Western Vinyl
description: Composer and songwriter David Wingo issues another strong LP whose expansiveness and Americana textures are reminiscent of MMJ or Band of Horses.

title: Solar Life Raft
label: Agriculture
description: After blowing minds with 2008's Uproot, and working with the Ex's Andy Moor, Brooklyn's DJ /rupture teams with Dutty Artz co-owner Matt Shadetek.

title: Harvest Festival
label: Greco-Roman
description: Hot Chip's co-frontman records his debut solo LP, a rippling set full of throbbing synthesizers and thudding drum machines.

title: Stills
label: Rough Trade
description: Belle and Sebastian's Stuart Murdoch follows his soundtrack to an unfinished movie with a new EP from his girl group- and musical theater-leaning project.

title: Islands
label: Labrador
description: Heart-on-sleeve Swedes return with another album of 1980s-indebted exquisite melancholy.

title: A Good Year for Hardness
label: Anchor Brain
description: After a 10-year hiatus, the hard-to-pin-down, forward-looking indie rock band returns.

title: Extended Vacation
label: Dead Oceans
description: The latest from the long-running side project of Wilco drummer Glenn Kotche and upright bassist Darin Gray, two focused, imaginative composers.

title: Rewolf
label: Polyvinyl
description: The dream-pop band offers nine stripped-down reimaginings of the duo's music, with a cover of Hope Sandoval's smoky 2002 single "Suzanne".

title: Bleach [Deluxe Edition] / Live at Reading
label: Sub Pop
description: Nirvana's scrappy Sub Pop debut is reissued with a 1990 live show as a bonus, and their legendary 1992 set at Reading is finally given a DVD/CD release.

title: Warm Brother
label: Fat Possum
description: Managed by Jay Reatard, Shawn Foree's project has a predictably rude sense of humor; here, he takes advantage of a full studio for the first time.

title: Visitation
label: Dangerbird
description: This California band blends the ambition of Omaha turn-of-the-millennium emo with tricked-out studio atmospherics.

title: Truce Opium
label: Emergency Umbrella
description: Ambitious Athens collective blend almost everything imaginable-- from drone metal to avant-jazz, Southern folk to classic rock-- into their huge sound.

title: Chomp More
label: DFA
description: An expanded reissue of the Athens post-punks' second album offers some clues to where they could have gone next.

title: Attention Deficit
label: Interscope
description: After three mixtapes-- highlighted by 2008's triumphant and savvy The Mixtape About Nothing-- Wale finally issues his debut LP.

title: Horror Disco
label: Bear Funk
description: With one foot in Italo disco and one in Goblin-like 1970s horror soundtrack, this debut LP is one of the more appropriately titled of the year.

title: Performing Parades
label: Leaf
description: The Danish art-rock collective records their second album with some of the Danish National Chamber Orchestra, so their already-epic songs become more so.

title: Ghana Special: Modern Highlife, Afro-Sounds & Ghanaian Blues 1968-1981
label: Soundway
description: This fine 2xCD companion to the earlier Nigeria Special comp highlights the musical connections between the two countries.

title: World Painted Blood
label: Sony
description: The best album from thrash metal's Big Four (Metallica, Megadeth, Slayer, Anthrax) since the 1990s is fast, finely controlled, and nearly fat-free.

title: Beast Rest Forth Mouth
label: Hometapes
description: The second full-length from this Brooklyn band is a striking consolidation of the spiky psych-prog tendencies of its 2007 debut into a pop framework.

title: Everything Is New
label: XL
description: The sophomore full-length from the UK singer-songwriter finds him broadening his palette to include textures from genres like Afropop and Tropicália.

title: Thriller
label: Rock Action
description: On their third album, loud Londoners Part Chimp slow down, stretch out, and sometimes indulge their metal side a little more.

title: Turning the Mind
label: Mute
description: Mercury-nominated producer with an ear for shoegaze textures returns with an album more invested in lyrics.

title: Broken
label: V2
description: Mark Lanegan again teams with UK electronic vets, with guest spots from Spiritualized's Jason Pierce, Mike Patton, Richard Hawley, and Gibby Haynes.

title: Warp20 (Box Set) / Warp20 (Chosen) / Warp20 (Recreated) / Warp20 (Unheard)
label: Warp
description: Warp celebrates 20 years in business with a massive box set collection.

title: When the Devil's Loose
label: Fat Possum
description: The second solo album from the one-time Verbena frontman continues his obsession with rough-hewn imagery and earthy song structures.

title: In the Gardens of the North
label: Bella Union
description: Bandleader Markland Starkie transforms lessons learned from his DIY home-taping years into fully-realized songs of all shapes and sizes.

title: Ay Ay Ay
label: Kompakt
description: Kompakt star and former Closer Musik member returns with a record of maximal oddity, an album far from his minimal roots.

title: Invisible Girl
label: In the Red
description: Shaking off the Almighty Defenders misstep, King Khan and Mark Sultan collaborate for another distillation of Nuggets and Brit Invasion rock.

title: Phrazes for the Young
label: RCA
description: Strokes singer makes his solo bow with a record of post-millennial synth-pop.

title: Midnight Soul Serenade
label: Fat Possum
description: Jon Spencer and Matt Verta-Ray continue to reinterpret the early days of rock'n'roll, emphasizing the rawness and raunchiness of it all.

title: Goodbye Cruel World, Hello Crueler World
label: Birdman
description: It's been a long time since you've heard a band pull off this sort of southern-fried slop-pop with such charm, craftiness, and self-deprecating wit.

title: Received Pronunciation
label: Slumberland
description: The Boston trio continues the tradition of wordy, tuneful, earnest underdogs from Small Factory and the Trashcan Sinatras to the Lucksmiths.

title: Molina and Johnson
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Magnolia Electric Co./Songs: Ohia's Jason Molina and Centro-Matic's Will Johnson team for a sleepy, evocative record.

title: Raditude
label: Geffen

title: Unbalance
label: Tectonic

title: Eccentric Soul: Smart's Palace
label: Numero Group
description: A soul music empire from Wichita, Kansas, and nearly lost to history is resurrected by the Numero Group on the latest comp from the imprint's winning series.

title: Blue Record
label: Relapse

title: Greatest Hits
label: RCA

title: Swords
label: Polydor
description: Twenty-track compilation gathers the B-sides of the indie legend's recent comeback years.

title: Under Stellar Steam
label: Jagjaguwar
description: British multi-instrumentalist mines fertile repetition on the latest compelling record in a compelling career.

title: Entropy
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: Portland dance-rockers offer an album of tightly constructed piano pop nuggets replete with overdubbed, harmonized vocals and loosely jazzy rhythms.

title: Shaft OST [Deluxe Edition]
label: Stax
description: Isaac Hayes' game-changing film score, which launched the soul/funk soundtrack craze in the early 70s, is given a deluxe reissue.

title: Unexpected Guests
label: Gold Dust Media
description: DOOM has the more scattershot pieces of his already scattershot discography compiled on this LP of lesser-known tracks.

title: The Unforgettable Fire [Deluxe Edition]
label: Mercury
description: U2's first collaboration with Brian Eno and Daniel Lanois comes across as a transitional album of the highest magnitude.

title: III
label: Drag City
description: Philly collective of freak-folkers-- led by Greg Weeks and Meg Baird-- move toward simplicity and directness.

title: Opiate Sun
label: Caldo Verde
description: Stop-gap EP from Justin Broadrick's most pop-oriented project foregrounds his memorable riffs and ringing climaxes.

title: Beak>
label: Ipecac

title: Sainthood
label: Vapor
description: The Quin twins follow their career peak The Con with another eclectic and personal record. Death Cab's Chris Walla produces.

title: What Will We Be
label: Warner Bros.
description: The preeminent songwriter and personality of New Weird America moves to Reprise without losing any of his eclecticism or quirk.

title: Smoke the Monster Out
label: Get Physical
description: UK-born, L.A.-based producer tries to reconcile a penchant for idiosyncratic sample collages with a career based on giving the crowd what it wants.

title: Strict Joy
label: Anti-
description: The Oscar-winning duo made famous in the popular indie film Once returns with their first post-film (and post-breakup) record.

title: Let's Build a Roof
label: K
description: The Olympia, Wash., group continues quietly to build an impressive arsenal of indie pop songs. Karl Blau produces.

title: Axe to Fall
label: Epitaph
description: One of the decade's best metal and post-hardcore bands finish the 2000s with one of its best records.

title: Live at the Olympia
label: Warner Bros.
description: This 2xCD LP, recorded over a five-night public rehearsal at a small venue in Dublin in 2007, attempts the colossal task of summing up a sprawling career.

title: Let's Just Stay Here
label: Mint
description: One of alt-country's best vocalists and underrated songwriters collaborates with some Toronto-based kindred spirits.

title: Hors d'Oeuvres
label: Paw Tracks
