title: Normal as Blueberry Pie - A Tribute to Doris Day
label: Verve
description: The eccentric singer-songwriter pays tribute to the music of Doris Day, from classics like "Sentimental Journey" to lesser-known songs from films.

title: Kaleidoscope
label: Ultra
description: Trance superstar trades voyages into the smiley faced ultraworld for collaborations with Sigur Rós, Bloc Party, Tegan and Sara, and more.

title: 5: Five Years of Hyperdub
label: Hyperdub

title: Summer of Fear
label: Saddle Creek

title: Let It Die
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: Portland band continues its Beatlesesque pop, here wrapping studies of mid-life anxieties in unfussy, steady-as-she-goes rockers.

title: Wayfaring Strangers: Lonesome Heroes
label: Numero Group

title: Investigate Witch Cults of the Radio Age
label: Warp

title: Head [Deluxe Edition] / Goat [Deluxe Edition] / Liar [Deluxe Edition] / Down [Deluxe Edition]
label: Touch and Go
description: The first four full-lengths from the hugely influential noise-rock band have been remastered by Steve Albini and Bob Weston and reissued.

title: Transition
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Viennese duo of Florian Kmet and Radian's Stefan Németh come together for an accessible and appealing album of electro-acoustic instrumentals.

title: The First Days of Spring
label: Cherrytree

title: Baghdad Batteries: Orbsessions Vol. III

title: Christmas in the Heart
label: Sony

title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon OST
label: Atlantic
description: The massively successful vampire franchise soundtracks its second film with Thom Yorke, Death Cab, Grizzly Bear, Muse, Bon Iver, St. Vincent, and more.

title: Grey-Eyed Girls
label: Woodsist
description: Prolific Bay Area band offers its latest album of jangly garage-pop, balancing psych-rock swagger with generous dollops of sweetly cockeyed melody.

title: Keep in Mind Frankenstein
label: Sub Pop
description: Ex-Band of Horses member Mat Brooke and co. follow their highly enjoyable debut with their latest Sub Pop release.

title: Break It Up
label: Ecstatic Peace
description: Be Your Own Pet's precocious singer goes solo and grows up a bit, the zombies and pizza parties of yore replaced with predicted "dark days."

title: Other Truths
label: Constellation
description: Toronto post-rock band's latest contains four lengthy tracks that add new dimensions and sharper textures to their sound.

title: Tarot Sport
label: ATP
description: The second full-length from this noisy Bristol duo is more accessible than their first but sacrifices none of that record's visceral power.

title: Barn Nova
label: Ecstatic Peace
description: After nearly a decade of small-run releases, Matt Valentine, Erika Elder, and co. bring their act to Thurston Moore's Ecstatic Peace for a third time.

title: Doomsday EP
label: XL
description: Elvis Perkins punctuates his intriguing In Dreamland LP with a six-song exercise in tinkering with the foundations of American music.

title: Feel Good Together
label: Audio Eagle
description: Black Keys' Patrick Carney leads a band of four other fulltime drummers on this guitar-driven record.

title: Trapped Animal
label: Narnack
description: The post-punk originals make a long-awaited return, updating their Jamaica/London sound for the digital age.

title: Logos
label: Kranky
description: With contributions from Lætitia Sadier of Stereolab and Panda Bear, the Deerhunter frontman continues to expand the parameters of his solo project.

title: Geneva
label: Suicide Squeeze
description: Chicago post-rock band makes its best album yet, both in structure and execution.

title: Black Beach
label: Paw Tracks
description: Working better in visual format than on disc, this CD/DVD from the often inscrutable experimental band captures a nice communing-with-nature spirit.

title: Skin and Bones / Mo Beauty
label: self-released
description: The Clap Your Hands Say Yeah frontman returns with two markedly different albums, one recorded with help from Philly pals and one recorded in New Orleans.

title: The Fountain
label: Ocean Rain
description: The 1980s legends continue their lengthy second act with a record that aims to remind listeners of the band's past rather than recast it in new light.

title: Wolfgang Amadeus Phoenix [Remix Collection]
label: Glassnote
description: Phoenix have their 2009 tracks remixed by Animal Collective, Passion Pit, Devendra Banhart, Chairlift, and more.

title: At the Cut
label: Constellation
description: Working with the same lineup as 2007's North Star Deserter, Chesnutt blends country-folk, Southern soul, and post-rock around dark, existential lyrics.

title: Yeah Ghost
label: Atlantic
description: Zero 7 return, not with a downtempo album but some sort of omnivorous post-MP3 pop record.

title: CrownsDown
label: Anticon
description: Anticon group takes up its rap-saving banner again in a major way, crafting a back-to-basics album.

title: The Real Feel
label: Matador
description: After working for a decade as the Preston School of Industry, Pavement founder Scott Kannberg releases his first album as Spiral Stairs.

title: I Told You I Was Freaky
label: Sub Pop
description: The faux-folk, hipster-doofus duo have their Season 2 music presented on disc, an exercise for fans rather than neophytes of the HBO show.

title: New Clouds
label: Kranky
description: Kranky pysch-rocker Adam Forkner indulges his spontaneous side on a heady record that's laid out like a modern classical or classic jazz work.

title: Zebra
label: K
description: K Records singer/songwriter embraces African music, crafting an ode to it and the music it prompted stateside.

title: Declaration of Dependence
label: EMI
description: Ignoring calls to fold Erlend Øye's hushed beats into their hushed folk, the Kings of quiet return with their most whisper-soft-- and graceful-- record yet.

title: Celebration
label: Warner Bros.
description: Another Madonna compilation: This 2xCD set collects roughly half of her singles, albeit sequenced in almost random order.

title: The BQE
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: Sufjan Stevens' multimedia work inspired by the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway, premiered in 2007 at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, is released as a CD/DVD set.

title: You Can't Take It With You
label: Triple Crown
description: Working within the easily licensed Jeff Buckley-Snow Patrol continuum, this Long Island band makes major-label melodrama.

title: Survival Skills
label: Duckdown
description: NYC rap vets offer a surprise collaboration, with guests Mary J. Blige, Bounty Killer, Slug, Talib Kweli, and Immortal Technique.

title: Love Is Not Pop
label: Licking Fingers
description: After a slight misstep, the Swedish singer/songwriter makes a heartbreaking return to form. Studio's Rasmus Hägg co-produces.

title: Is and Always Was
label: High Wire
description: Jason Falkner produces the latest record from Daniel Johnston, giving the iconoclastic singer/songwriter the rich canvas he has so long deserved.

title: Earthly Delights
label: Load
description: On their first LP in four years, Lightning Bolt offer a record in which most tracks center around growling chords and monolithic beats.

title: The Conformist
label: Brassland
description: Thomas Bartlett continues on his quiet musical path, here with contributions from Norah Jones and Matt Berninger of the National.

title: We're on Your Side
label: Hometapes

title: Know Better Learn Faster
artist: Thao with the Get Down Stay Down
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: After a personal, sometimes exuberant debut, Thao Nguyen's follow-up is the post-party comedown, a collection of hard-learned lessons.

title: Dillanthology 3
label: Rapster
description: Mostly sourced from his classic 2000s LPs, the latest J Dilla comp is also therefore arguably the most familiar music and least essential intro.

title: Tongue N' Cheek
label: Dirtee Stank
description: Dizzee's self-released dance-pop record has three UK #1 singles, but it's the album tracks that make this a worthwhile and often enjoyable listen.

title: Wildlife
label: Polyvinyl

title: All the Pleasures of the World
label: Chapter
description: Like an indie-pop Kurt Vile, this Aussie artist transforms classic rock touchstones into something affecting and winning-- in this case, charming indie pop.

title: Rio [Collector's Edition] / Live at Hammersmith '82!
label: EMI
description: Duran Duran reissue and expand their one truly great album, plus issue a live document of their ascendancy to transatlantic superstardom.

title: Splitting the Atom
label: Virgin
description: Massive Attack preview their new LP with an EP of two new songs and two remixes of songs we've yet to hear-- plus contributions from TVOTR and Elbow.

title: The Life of the World to Come
label: 4AD

title: The Yolks
label: Bachelor
description: Chicago garage-rockers craft a no-nonsense album of simple pleasures that's direct, unpretentious, and joyful.

title: Imidiwan: Companions
label: World Village
description: Following their 2007 breakthrough Aman Iman: Water Is Life, the desert guitar band from Mali returns with a more communal album.

title: 45 Live
label: Stones Throw
description: Stones Throw head manages the impressive task of artfully mixing 7" singles on this trip down hip hop's memory lane.

title: Live at the El Mocambo
label: Hip-O Select

title: Psychic Chasms
label: Lefse

title: Abstract Expression
label: Important

title: Good Morning Jokers
label: Borne
description: Finnish duo with a flair for fashion returns with their first album in four years and it's filled with more frosty, slowly developing folk music.

title: Butter
label: Warp
description: Glasgow producer sounds both richer and more restless, serving up pitched-up hip-hop, tripped-up drum patterns, and shorted-out 8-bit melodies.

title: Sunset/Sunrise
label: Hardly Art
description: Seattle duo's sophomore effort balances the darker qualitites of their debut with Jesse Lortz's murkier musings on the birth of his first son.

title: Embryonic
label: Warner Bros.
description: In a shocking turn, the Flaming Lips offer their most audacious undertaking since Zaireeka, an unrelentingly paranoid, static-soaked acid-rock epic.

title: DJ-Kicks
label: !K7

title: Death Acoustic
label: MVD Audio
description: As its title implies, this is a stripped-down solo album from the former Queens of the Stone Age co-leader.

title: Ciao My Shining Star: The Songs of Mark Mulcahy
label: Shout! Factory
description: Thom Yorke, Michael Stipe, the National, and Dinosaur Jr. turn out for this charity tribute to the man best known for the theme song to "Pete & Pete".

title: Never Cry Another Tear
label: Triple Echo
description: Ex-New Order members Bernard Sumner, Stephen Morris, and Phll Cunningham unveil their new project. Blur's Alex James guests.

title: Scars
label: XL
description: The eclectic dance duo dial it back a bit on the most effective parts of their latest album.

title: Magic Neighbor
label: Young God
description: While characteristically downcast, the eighth album from Germano lifts some of the gauze and exhibits a bit more warmth and playfulness.

title: Zero to 99
label: Guided By Voices, Inc.
description: Robert Pollard quietly continues his excellent 2009 with another often-rewarding Boston Spaceships release. R.E.M.'s Peter Buck guests.

title: Childish Prodigy
label: Matador
description: Drawing heavily on road-weary classic rock and folk-rock, Kurt Vile makes the leap from lo-fi all-star to Matador's impressive class of 2009.

title: Fluorescent Black
label: Big Dada
description: The caustic, adventurous hip-hop group returns for its first non-collaborative album in seven years.

title: Where the Wild Things Are OST
label: DGC
description: Karen O leads an all-star team (including members of YYYs, Liars, and Deerhunter) on the OST for Spike Jonze's film version of the Maurice Sendak classic.

title: Chicken Switch
label: Ipecac
description: Sonic Youth's Lee Ranaldo, Matmos, and Boredoms' Eye Yamatsuka are among participants in a remix LP that's more like a comp of excellent experimental music.

title: Goodnight Unknown
label: Merge
description: On his second solo album under his own name, the indie rock veteran does a little of everything he does well and improves on his last outing, Emoh.

title: Bonfires on the Heath
label: Merge
description: Capping off one of the decade's great bodies of mood music, the Clientele continue to conjure and charm through their evocative music.

title: Ghostdini: The Wizard of Poetry in Emerald City
label: Def Jam
description: Whether as a commercial concession or an experimental detour, Ghost goes full-tilt R&B on his new album.

title: Run Rabbit Run
label: Asthmatic Kitty

title: Family
label: Hardly Art

title: Where the Action Is! Los Angeles Nuggets 1965-1968
label: Rhino
description: Rhino continues its expansion of the Nuggets brand with a 4xCD look at the fertile Sunset Strip and other SoCal musical locales of 1965-68.

title: Dead Man's Bones
label: Anti-
description: Oscar-nominated actor Ryan Gosling gets a friend and a children's choir together for a truly unusual and surprising record.

title: In and Out of Control
label: Vice
description: Sticking with the sure-footed, loud formula that suited them on their debut and Lust Lust Lust, these Danish JAMC acolytes are back on a roll.

title: Warm Heart of Africa
label: Green Owl
description: The full-length debut from this Afropop project rises to the high standard of their 2008 mixtape; guests include M.I.A. and Ezra Koenig of Vampire Weekend.

title: Six

title: Exploding Head
label: Mute
description: The loud New York band with gothic/shoegaze overtones returns with album number two, which tones down the volume slightly and puts more focus on songwriting.

title: Losing Feeling
label: Sub Pop
description: Returning to EPs after their incredible first proper LP, No Age inject more tension and shimmering guitars into their already excellent punk rock.

title: Love 2
label: Astralwerks
description: The Gallic duo aim to dust off the disappointment of Pocket Symphony with their first LP to be written and recorded without a major outside producer.

title: There Is No Enemy
label: Warner Bros.
description: Built to Spill arrest their 2000s slide with the unexpected There Is No Enemy, their best album in years.

title: A Strange Arrangement
label: Stones Throw
description: Stones Throw's one-man soul band is almost too sweet for his own good.

title: Threats/Worship
label: Vice
description: Latest from a Toronto band so easy to love they've been released by both the anti-corporate people at Constellation and the trendspotters at Vice.

title: I and Love and You
label: Columbia
description: One of the biggest grassroots success stories of the decade makes their well-deserved, Rick Rubin-assisted major-label bow.

title: My Weakness Is Strong
label: Warner Bros.
description: Patton Oswalt is now more mature and even grown-up, but everything that makes him the funniest stand-up around is still in place on his new album.

title: Hello Nasty [Deluxe Edition]

title: Threadbare
label: TBD

title: Born Again Revisited
label: Matador
description: Matador band's highest-fidelity album to date, an intentional playing down of the things that made them among lo-fi's leading lights.

title: Milwaukee at Last!!!
label: Decca
description: His second live album, but first covering his own material, this CD/DVD set finds Rufus Wainwright playing the role he was born to play: himself.

title: Man on the Moon: The End of Day
label: Universal Motown

title: White Lunar
label: Mute
description: Nick Cave and Dirty Three/Bad Seeds member Warren Ellis collect two discs of soundtrack work, including pieces from the new adaptation of The Road.

title: LOVEWORLD
label: Mannheim
description: U.S.E. finally follow its debut with another LP of post-Daft Punk house music, twee indie rock, and a sort of "Sesame Street"-esque funk.

title: Bright Penny
label: Broken Horse
description: Chicago's hard-luck cult artist finally offers his third album, 11 years after debuting with the exquisite, underrated More You Becomes You.

title: The Spoils
label: Sacred Bones
description: Their gothy sound is reminiscent of Siouxsie and the Banshees and Cabaret Voltaire, but on their first proper full-length Zola Jesus show a distinctive voice.

title: All My Friends Are Funeral Singers
label: Dead Oceans
description: The remarkably consistent band continues its strong run here, with another album of fine songs that combine earthy instrumentation and artful noise.

title: Seek Magic
label: Sincerely Yours
description: Producer Dayve Hawk, who has created dreamy electro soundscapes as Memory Cassette, Weird Tapes, and Memory Tapes, arrives with a striking new album.

title: Manafon
label: Samadhi Sound
description: Former Japan leader strengthens his ties to modern avant-garde, be it jazz, electro-acoustic improvisation, post-glitch electronics, or modern composition.

title: Sing Along to Songs You Don't Know
label: Morr
description: Icelandic band remains pretty obsessed with the kind of childlike innocence that attracts or repels people with equal fervor.

title: I Am the Cosmos [Deluxe Edition]
label: Rhino
description: This set from Rhino Handmade augments the former Big Star member's posthumous collection of solo material with an extra disc of alternate versions and mixes.

title: The Sound the Speed the Light
label: Matador
description: The most industrious of their three post-reunion albums, The Sound's songs are so signature-styled you might wonder if you've heard them before.

title: 45:33 Remixes
label: DFA
description: James Murphy's contribution to Nike's intermittent series of one-artist mixes designed for exercise gets a belated remix treatment.

title: Columbus'd the Whim
label: Twosyllable
description: With a name like Holiday Shores, you'd guess this Florida group is part of 2009's fuzzed-out, beach-party vibe. You'd be right.

title: Fool's Gold
label: IAMSOUND
description: Foreign Born's Lewis Pesacov has been filtering African music into his songs for ages, but his new project will still attract Vampire Weekend comparisons.

title: Where Were You When It Happened?
label: Drag City

title: Vapours
label: Anti-
description: After the relative darkness of Arm's Way, Islands welcomes back original member Jamie Thompson and makes a welcome return to the sound of their debut.

title: The Sun Came Out
label: Columbia
description: Crowded House's Neil Finn leads a number of artists-- members of Radiohead and Wilco, Johnny Marr, and Lisa Germano-- on this ambitious 2xCD project.

title: White Clouds Drift On and On
label: Echospace
description: Typically working with dub and ambient music as Bvdub, here Van Wey ditches drums and bass for a full-on, immersive Gas-inspired experience.

title: Through the Devil Softly
label: Nettwerk
description: Former Mazzy Star singer keeps the aesthetic of her former band very much alive on this collaboration with My Bloody Valentine drummer Colm Ó Cíosóig.

title: Higher Than the Stars EP
artist: The Pains of Being Pure at Heart
label: Slumberland
description: Highlighting the bookish indie pop at their core, this Pains EP still sounds classic and timeless, even if it's more Field Mice than Shop Assistants.

title: Eskimo Snow
label: Anticon
description: After the vulnerable masterstroke Alopecia, WHY? unleash a record that's darker in content but often gorgeous in sound.

title: Album
label: True Panther
description: Girls have been the subject of a steadily building buzz based on some excellent singles, and they deliver on that promise here in a big way.

title: Colonial Drones
label: Misra
description: Still taking cues from both 1990s lo-fi and ambitious 2000s indie, Hallelujah the Hills continue to expand and improve their sound.

title: Expressions
label: Secretly Canadian

title: Us
label: Rhymesayers
description: What comes across as moralistic sermonizing from lesser MCs here is the work of a rapper with a humane, often-troubled conscience.

title: Forget the Night Ahead
label: Fat Cat
description: Evocative, emo-ish lyrics and Kevin Shields-by-way-of-Thurston Moore torrents of noise once again color the work of this Scottish band.

title: Unmap
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Justin Vernon of Bon Iver teams up with the post-rock outfit Collections of Colonies of Bees for a loose, weird, and rewarding album.

title: Origin: Orphan
label: Arts & Crafts
description: Joel Gibb makes his "mature" album, trading the joyful glee of past Hidden Cameras work for increased gravity and seriousness.

title: 69: The Legendary Adventures of a Filter King
label: Planet E
description: Detroit techno legend collects lesser-known older material originally created under his 69 moniker, reissuing it as a vinyl-only, 5x12" release.

title: Year in the Kingdom
label: Western Vinyl
description: The newest Fleet Foxes member has been crafting hushed folk for years, and he stays prolific as a solo artist with this, his second LP of the year.

title: Between My Head and the Sky
label: Chimera
description: The new Plastic Ono Band stays true to the original's friends-and-family vibe, recruiting Sean Lennon, Cibo Matto's Yuka Honda, and Cornelius.

title: Monsters of Folk
label: Shangri-La Music
description: Bright Eyes' Conor Oberst, My Morning Jacket's Jim James, M. Ward, and Saddle Creek's Mike Mogis create a folk-pop supergroup, our era's Traveling Wilburys.

title: Marlone
label: Kranky
description: Operating with one foot in the avant-garde and the other in the structural, this Kranky band hews closer to Deerhunter or Low than that label's dronier artists.

title: Texas Rose, the Thaw, and the Beasts
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: Raymond Raposa's ramshackle folk and pitch-dark music would sound at home in either a Village coffee shop or a roadhouse.

title: Truelove's Gutter
label: Mute
description: A few years after the outstanding Coles Corner, former Pulp touring member continues his atmospheric, nostalgic work as a singer-songwriter.

title: Live From Home
label: Team Love
description: Another in a line of 1990s stalwarts making their recent comeback, these D.C. art-rockers document their 2008 reunion tour on this live disc.

title: Backspacer
label: Interscope
description: Former "biggest band on the planet" continues its yeoman's work, making anonymously dependable riff-rock for those who want that sort of thing.

title: DIA
label: Locust
description: Damon McMahon's Locust release recalls other claustrophobic, inner-space travelers like Syd Barrett, Roky Erickson, and Skip Spence.

title: Crayon Angel: A Tribute to the Music of Judee Sill
label: American Dust
description: Cult folk artist Judee Sill gets a tribute with contributions from Bill Callahan, Grizzly Bear's Daniel Rossen, Beth Orton, Marissa Nadler, and more.

title: Two Sunsets
label: Domino
description: Scottish indie pop legends team with Japanese duo Tenniscoats to record their first non-soundtrack studio album in 12 years.

title: Central Market
label: Warp
description: In his first post-Mirrored release, the Battles leader enlists the Wordless Music Orchestra to craft a record of ambitious modern classical music.

title: Rain Machine
label: Anti-
description: TV on the Radio guitarist/singer Kyp Malone subverts expectations on this solo project, creating both gentle, atmospheric detours and kinetic drama.

title: La Roux
label: Polydor
description: This record of unapologetically derivative 80s synth-pop is already a sensation in the UK, boasting a pair of hit singles.

title: Keep an Eye on the Sky
label: Rhino
description: Combining studio tracks, live cuts, demos, and unreleased recordings, Rhino' 4xCD compilation is the reissue that finally gets Big Star right.

title: Time to Die
label: Frenchkiss
description: Like many ambitious indie bands before them, the Dodos enlist producer Phil Ek to help craft their rise to indie fame.

title: Kamaal the Abstract
label: Jive
description: Q-Tip's long-delayed experimental album, cut at the beginning of the decade with contributions from jazz musicians, is finally given a proper release.

title: The Visitor
label: Drag City
description: After years of foregoing recorded music for other pursuits, Jim O'Rourke makes a brilliant return with a subtly complex 38-minute piece of orchestral pop.

title: Black Telephone of Matter
label: Touch
description: Like Kreng before him, Pan Sonic's Mika Vainio is making dark, compelling, almost frightening music.

title: Brooklynati
label: Interdependent Media
description: This indie hip-hop group has been lauded as a flamekeeper for a certain time in the early 1990s when the Native Tongues held down New York.

title: So Tough / Sound of Water
label: Heavenly
description: The expanded 2xCD reissues of the St. Etienne catalogue continue with 1993's terrific So Tough and 2000's Sound of Water.

title: A Brief History of Love
label: 4AD
description: A study in the enormity of sound, the debut from this arena-ready UK band delivers on the promise of its early singles.

title: Only Built 4 Cuban Linx... Pt. II
label: EMI
description: The Wu-Tang Clan member's long-awaited sequel to his 1995 classic is finally here, and yes, it's as good as fans have been hoping for.

title: Inglourious Basterds OST
label: Reprise
description: Quentin Tarantino's first period piece largely ignores cratedigging pop, rock, and soul, instead offering forgotten B-movie cues or clever cinematic in-jokes.

title: God Is Good
label: Drag City
description: Grails' Emil Amos joins Om's former Sleep member Al Cisneros and, despite some fears that he'd busy their sound, he fits right in.
